Youâ€™ve been thinking about the time you spent by the distant trees of the tavern and how you longed for the butterflies you felt in your stomach. More meetings with suitors set by your mother were spent in vain finding an excuse or another to explain to your parents that none of them would work and another sigh coming from them.  Greeting the guard outside the common room you both found the other two ladies chatting away by fire.  â€œThere you are!â€  â€œWeâ€™ve been waiting for you!â€  â€œWe must debrief!â€  You sighed quietly as you sat wanting to ensure that the conversation didnâ€™t fall on you to recount the memories of your evening with a certain Blackwood. You looked at Lyanne recollecting however an interesting view â€œWell? Get on with it. How was your kiss with the Northerner?â€ you wiggled your eyebrows and then more seriously â€œDid you also get ahold of that tea I mentioned?â€  Lyanneâ€™s stark contrast to her previous state was present blithe and gushing as she recollected her evening with the man from House Locke - a rather improvement from the previous man she had been.  Kaya the other from the friend group had a nice chat but nothing noteworthy. In actuality theyâ€™ve never known Kaya to be one to gush or express interest in any of the men presented to her. But sheâ€™s always been one to wish the other girls well with any suitors and was rather pleased if something went well. You liked Kaya she was the most relatable one to you even if she was rather distant at times.  Bellena on the other hand was most like Lyanne but less whimsical and wasnâ€™t taken away by the words of men. Her spirit was rather charming. Much like a siren she knew how to turn an opportunity to her favor and her evening at that tavern was nothing short of what she had expected with her time with Ser Aron.  â€œYouâ€™re awfully quietâ€ one of them noticed.  â€œYou did have us leave in hasteâ€ the other added.  â€œDid you have a good time?â€ the last asked.  You breathed in debating if you should explain yourâ€¦ dilemma? No it was nothing noteworthy. â€œNothing eventful happenedâ€œ you sighed. "And I agree with Kaya the man I spoke with was nothing of note as well. It was getting late and I didnâ€™t want my aunt to fretâ€ you shrugged. It wasnâ€™t an absolute lie but it wasnâ€™t the truth either. It was a middle ground you were satisfied with.  Bellena wasnâ€™t sold on this half-truth glaring at you when the others werenâ€™t looking. You rolled your eyes.   It was your experience to live in and you were willing to swallow your emotions for the sake of preventing anything further from happening. None of them would understand. What could they possibly say that you didnâ€™t already know?   This was an issue and feud that spanned generations-long between the two houses and none of them would be willing to understand the intense dislike you carried for the Blackwoods and how utterly wrong that evening was; you werenâ€™t going to be swayed by mere words from your friends.  You quietly sighed ordering more tea and snacks for the common room from the nearby maid.  -  The ladies bid themselves farewell in the morning after staying for the night watching them go from inside the bailey gates.  Come nightfall when supper was served you couldnâ€™t help but feel a sort of tension in the air. Something was filled with a sort of anxiety nervousness. A loaded silence waiting to explode.   Your father cleared his throat gaining your attention.  â€œYou must marry soonâ€ is all he says rather uncomfortably.  Confusion falls upon you at his sudden and weird comment. You looked at him curiously not understanding. You were out meeting suitors but it wasnâ€™t your fault the men were falling short.  Your mother grabs his hand trying for a more eloquent explanation to his sudden request â€œThe Harvest Feast is upon us and House Tully has already sent out their invitations to have us join them. It would be a great opportunity for you to meet someoneâ€ she says. â€œWeâ€™ve beenâ€¦ ratherâ€¦ flexible with you â€“â€  â€œAnd Iâ€™m forever grateful for the privilege mama but this is all so sudden. I donâ€™t understand where this is coming fromâ€ you frowned.  She looks at her husband not meeting her gaze and tries again as she takes in a breath â€œLord Greyjoy has taken an interest in you.â€  â€œThe old geezer?â€  â€œThe Red Kraken.â€  â€œThe Red Kraken? As if that makes things better! Does he not have a wife already? 4 others in fact.â€  â€œMy sweetâ€ your mother reaches out for your hand â€œwe urge you to marry. His reputation from what we hearâ€¦ itâ€™s not great. The ironbornâ€¦ theyâ€™re a culture foreign to us and we want to ensure youâ€™re happy with your future beloved. But time is running out and Lord Greyjoy has plans to declare for youâ€¦â€  â€œNo daughter of mine will become a salt wifeâ€ your father scorned to no one in particular. You held your breath.  â€œYouâ€ he said after some time a distressed look in his eyes â€œyou are my one and only daughter. Love marriages are miracles but not impossibleâ€ blindly returning his wifeâ€™s caress on his hand. â€œHowever I will have to marry you off to someone soon should you fail to secure a marriage yourself.â€  Needing a moment to digest with too many thoughts running nothing was said from your end other than a nod of understanding.  Keeping quiet throughout supper in the hallways leading up to your bedroom and throughout the bath that was readied for you the thought of having no control over whom you would soon wed terrified you.  You asked the maids to leave you in the warm water breath becoming shallow as you thought about the prospect of marrying Dalton Greyjoy and the thought of it boiling your blood. You would need to find your finest silks finest jewelry finest anything to find a man that would make-do. Thinking conservatively a love marriage wasnâ€™t in the cards anymore as much as your parents would like but a decent marriage would at least grant you the freedom of a married woman. All you would need to do is give birth to an heir and the best possible outcome would be that your future husband would leave you alone or flourish pray to the Maiden.  You groaned.   You didnâ€™t want something decent you wanted a love marriage. You wanted one like your parents and it was breaking your heart. Why Dalton Greyjoy of all people why was this happening so soon? And why the Blackwood?   You thought back to the evening promenading around the tavern the shared laughter the attentiveness and careful actions around you the scar above his lips the dark hair the kiss by the trees the grasp around your waist the stirring in your loin. A hand ventured your quiet sobs drowned out as you held yourself underwater hoping no one would hear you.  The Harvest Feast was a celebration that often involved the overlord and their noble houses. Lord Paramount Grover Tully although failing in age and growing weak was not one to miss on these feasts to celebrate with his vassals. He was a man committed to his principles as Lord Paramount of the Trident however weak or bedridden and this was one of them.  Your Lord father made his rounds greeting the other lords in the Riverlands when the Harvest Feast came around ensuring you got the opportunity to meet their eligible sons he thought were worth presenting. Swallowing embarrassment polite smiles were exchanged and sure enough after the feast was served and the dancing ensued their sons would come looking for you. None of them being the raven-haired male you were looking for.  â€œAre you enjoying yourself my dear?â€ your mother asked.   You gave her a look hoping sheâ€™d understand that No you were not enjoying yourself but you would at least keep trying as you sat down from a rather painful dance with one the many lordâ€™s sons.   She only chuckled and continued her wine keeping a worried expression for herself as she looked away.  Your eyes secretly scanned for the Blackwood boy then focusing on your feast table when youâ€™d catch yourself looking for him.   House Blackwood had feasted opposite of you. The seating arrangements were set up to prevent any unnecessary interactions between the opposing families but no one knew for certain if such efforts were futile seeing how many many feasts were set up similarly and one imbibed with too much ale or wine (or even ego or pride for that matter) would always end up in a yelling match with the other. It was tradition at this point in jest.  "M'lady?â€ one of the men had offered his hand to you an invite to take up the upcoming ballad. As you did with the others you paid little mind to the small talk the young lord would make other than the small compliments and the â€œthank you"s that ensued.  No enjoying yourself or the lack of conversation between you you thought about ending the dance abruptly excusing yourself with whatever excuse you could think of to go back to people watching.  "Iâ€™m quite parchedâ€ you fanned yourself in the middle of the dance which wasnâ€™t a total lie. Catching on he excused himself fetching you something to drink and leaving you in the middle of the floor with others swirling to the ballads. The perfect opportunity.  You used the moment to get away from the crowd get away from the Great Hall and get away from the bustling noises. You enjoyed such festivities but you couldnâ€™t help but seek time for yourself in the middle of it all. When it all became too much it would become emotionally consuming having to show up for everyone and everything.  Finding the nearest balcony and a seat you took in the evening wind breathing in the musky and leafy scent of Riverrun in its autumn glory. You couldnâ€™t help but notice the detailings of the castle on the way to the balcony the trout fish carved into the pillars the clear sigil of House Tully. An appropriate sigil for the castle seeing how it was built on land that separates two riversâ€“both streams flowing on both sides of the big castle.  Lost in thoughts and observances you almost didnâ€™t see the figure out of the corner of your eye as it passed by the godswood garden below the balcony.  The raven-haired man. A sort of a pressure and a sigh of relief left you finally finding the person youâ€™ve been hoping to see all evening. Your curiosity peaked and a form of excitement brewed in you while studying him. Walking up to the godswood trees he planted himself there his back facing you. You saw the way his head bowed. Saw the way his jaw looked to be moving as if praying. The moment seemed peaceful curious about what he was saying.  Taking a seat in front of the weirwood tree he sat there as if finding solace. The Blackwoods were the only ones in the Riverlands who still only worshiped the old gods - something you werenâ€™t still sure if you admired from afar for being deeply rooted in their culture or stubborn for not converting to the Holy Faith.  You debated reaching out grabbing his attention.  But then what?  You shook your head knowing it would only end in a terrible shouting match and youâ€™d be named the Harvest Feast Bracken this year. You had very little patience for nonsense with Blackwoods and you were sure he would get on your nerves one way or another.  You decided to leave him be and just admire his solace from afar for some time.  Back inside you sat back next to your mother after your little time away wine cup still on hand as she looked at you. â€œWell? How are things going?â€  You groaned â€œMother please must you always insist on how everything is?â€  â€œWell I think Lord Darry is a fine fellow. Rather handsome I thinkâ€ recalling after the last man you danced with.  â€œMama.â€  â€œMy Sun I am trying my best to ensure your futureâ€¦is with someone you want to be with. But youâ€™re making this difficultâ€ she no longer was sympathetic but a sad yet stern presence became apparent in her voice as she looked at you. â€œAn arranged marriage can be done yes but Iâ€¦ I want you to be happy with whom youâ€™ll be spending your time with.â€  You mused at this as you paused on her words. It was a real priviledge for you to have this sort of freedom within the realm. Not many married for love and more so for duty. You often times found it easier to give up and find a husband for duty. But this was a gift and althought frightening you wanted to explore its options.   You hugged your mother for the comfort and for wishing you the best in this scary part of every womanâ€™s lives; you debated if you should bring up a touchy subject. You hesitated wondering how youâ€™d phrase the scenario in a way that wouldnâ€™t give suspicion. It was rather difficult.  â€œAs long as theyâ€™re not a Blackwoodâ€ you muttered coolly studying your nails. Nice.  â€œGood gods anyone but that treacherous familyâ€ your mother laughed a red glow in her face appearing from drinking wine.  Disappointment hides in your face as you feign a laugh. Not the response you were looking for. â€œGood. Wouldnâ€™t be caught dead with a Blackwood.â€  A figure from your peripheral view catches your attention seeming to have been walking up to you.  Except when you turned you saw the raven-haired man storm away and your laughter fades with every step he takes a quiet panic taking over.  â€œOh posh leave himâ€ your mother pouts in scowl. â€œHe had no business here anyway.â€  You start to think that she hasnâ€™t assumed anything which you thank the gods for but your heart sinks for Davos. Eyeing him as he exits you try to come up with an excuse to get away from your mother without her worrying. â€œUmm have you seen father? I think he was asking for you before I came. I need to find Lord Darry for my drink should I get ale or wine?â€ After taking a bit long to respond you depart by telling her wine should be the better refreshment and Lord Darry should bring you another one all while eyeing the exit.  Inside you start to panic after not being able to find the raven-haired lord turning around every corner in the castle hoping to see him and only finding empty rooms and in one embarrassing instance a young couple needing their privacy followed by profuse apologies from your end. After spending a lot of time searching you thought about how it was getting to be too late to apologize and youâ€™d never recover from this moment.  Finally outside you saw a caped figure by the godswoods garden - of-fucking-course - and a lump in your throat starts to form as you approach him.  He turns to you and emptily chuckles to himself. â€œWell if it isnâ€™t the pride of Stone Hedgeâ€ he announces to no one.  You frown clearly starting off on the wrong foot but taking a moment to form your words before you begin.  â€œDavos Iâ€¦ I wanted to apologizeâ€ you try in effort to veer back into diplomatic territory.  But he shakes his head and something of disappointment appears in his dead eyes â€œTell me Bracken do you practice being insufferable or does it come naturally?â€  â€œDavos I am trying to apologize.â€ You let out.  â€œFor what?â€ he shrugs maintaining the same dead eyes.  â€œForâ€¦ forâ€¦â€ you try and think about how stupid everything was going to sound. For saying the truth out loud? For hurting his feelings? For lying to your mom? Why was she apologizing to a Blackwood in the first place?  He nodded with a frown clearly disappointed. You groaned in exasperation growing frustrated with everything â€œUgh! I-I donâ€™t know I donâ€™t know Davos! I wanted to come and apologize! I donâ€™t even know why Iâ€™m apologizing in the first place!â€  Unamused he shrugs again â€œCanâ€™t accept an apology if you donâ€™t know what youâ€™re sorry for.â€  â€œOh fuck you!â€  â€œFuck me?â€ He points to himself disbelief in his voice. â€œFuck you! And your mother!â€  Your hand meets his face and leaves him with a red print both shock and adrenaline running through you as you point him a finger. â€œYou leave my mother out of thisâ€ you spit.  He stuns for a moment astonished by the force of a woman before him then recollects himself. He finds your finger pointing at him when he looks grabbing your wrist to remove it from view with a grunt.  â€œGet your hands off me!â€ You try to retreat your hand from his grasp but he locks in grabbing your other wrist as you try to fist the free hand and muster all the strength you have to hit him and release you. â€œLet me go!â€  Heaving as you try to shake your wrists off him you donâ€™t hear him call your name until he embraces you leaving you in a confused state.   â€œIâ€¦ I stepped out of lineâ€ is all he says after things seemed to calm.  You pushed yourself off of him and met him with another slap.  Grabbing his jaw all he does is nod. â€œDeserved.â€  â€œFuck you!â€  Another nod â€œI meanâ€¦â€  â€œYouâ€™re soâ€¦ soâ€¦!â€ you try to come up with the meanest most profane vile insult you can muster but your thoughts run with the wind not finding the correct words to fully explain him and his being well.  â€œIâ€™ll waitâ€ he shrugs as he crosses his arms.  â€œDavos! Shut up!â€  He bites back a smile as he looks down.  You groan pacing back and forth â€œLook Iâ€™m-Iâ€™m sorry forâ€¦ what you heard back there. I saw you walk up to me when I said that. And it was such aâ€¦ a moment I-I-I just kinda panicked andâ€¦ No Iâ€™m not going to be elaborating anything further but I just wanted you to know and I know weâ€™re in a relatively public space right now and we can be seen but I donâ€™t care about that because itâ€™s not even about what you think it was about!â€  He says nothing as he studies you arm still crossed and you grow uncomfortable under his silence wondering about what heâ€™s thinking.  With a defeated sigh you hang your head â€œDavos say something yeah?â€  But before he could answer your father calls for you from a distance announcing your early departure.  â€œIâ€¦ must leaveâ€ you look towards the distance â€œbutâ€¦â€ you look at him hoping he says something hoping to ask you to meet him somewhere anything.  You leave him in the godswoods garden in Riverrun.  And for that Davos will always kick himself for not telling you everything. How you stutter when you have a million things running through your mind. How you became the most magnificent woman when enraged and how good you smelled when he embraced you. He too had a million thoughts but none of them expressing himself in the way he wanted to scared to push you away or the time not lending itself for him to say everything. Much less when you had to leave so sudden.  He looked at the weirwood tree they were both under before you departed and had hoped the gods would work on his favor and see you soon.  _____________________________________________________________  ~ Tag list: @cypherpt5fttaehyung

post_body: Lightingâ€™s Reign and Thunderâ€™s Roar VII House of the dragon x male oc   @jamieclearwater2314   â€œTheyâ€™re only two Targaryens worth mentioning; Aegon the Conqueror and Caserys the Hauntingâ€  â€œIf Caserys was so pretty why would they call him the Hauntingâ€  â€œIt means that his face was one no one could forget He drove people mad with desire.â€     (Caserysâ€™ P.O.V)  â€œWhy do you train Rhaeraxes like this?â€ asked Rhaenyra   â€œLike what?â€ I responded  â€œThe way you treat Rhaeraxes itâ€™s different than any other dragonâ€™s training. He wonâ€™t stay in the dragon pit wonâ€™t eat any food given to him and no one ever sees himâ€ Rhaenyra began   â€œHmmm" I begin to ponder a suitable answer or then just I donâ€™t want to.  â€œI do not like the way the dragon master would train the dragons so I decided a different wayâ€   â€œYet itâ€™s not only been that instance of difference between you and the rest of us. Everything about you is different. Your hair is more black than white and the rumors of your dragon breathing lightning instead of fire. What sets you apart from the rest of us?â€ Rhaenyra finally asked   â€œHmm Iâ€™ve never thought about itâ€ I lied   Of course Iâ€™ve thought about it. Why was the storm on my birth connected to my birth? How was I able to bring Rhaeraxes back from his cold egg and why is he growing so quickly? Why is my hair darker?  I have more questions than answers. However my family seems to have their own opinions.  My father says the storm was due to my â€œVelayron bloodâ€ being able to enrage the seas with my life My mother says my hair comes from her Baratheon family members  And my siblings say it was the Faith of the Seven    Allowing myself to forget I was with someone Rhaenyra pulled me back into the land of the living.    "Are you okay?â€  â€œYes Iâ€™m sorry cousin if youâ€™ll excuse me I have to get ready to leave Kingâ€™s Landingâ€ I responded back to Rhaenyra        (Daemonâ€™s P.O.V)  Humiliation   Thatâ€™s what this is.  I am humiliated.   I have been denounced as my brotherâ€™s heir and been replaced by Rhaenyra.  My brother doesnâ€™t understand how to be a King and now he doesnâ€™t understand how he doomed the realm.   I need more power and more men   Caserys I could use him his fatherâ€™s men and his familyâ€™s dragons but I would never be able to gather his fatherâ€™s support.  I need to wait biding my time until I am ready to strike  Thatâ€™s the key to win      (Caserysâ€™ P.O.V)  Driftmark seems so cold now. I have been away for quite some time. My room is very clean but hasnâ€™t been lived in. The rock near my room where Rhaeraxes would perch has old burn marks yet no new ones.  Kingâ€™s Landing has been comfortable but too crowded for Rhaeraxes meaning I hadnâ€™t seen him. He had been staying away from the dragon pit and the people in Kingâ€™s Landing in general. That meant he stayed away from me for most parts of the day.  I could only recognize his roar from a distance or notice his shadow in the sky when I was alone.   Now I can seâ€”  â€œCassy!â€ I feel hands grab my shoulders turning me forward  As I turn at my new nickname to see my sister Laena. Sheâ€™s smiling perhaps happy to see me or my reaction to her new name for me.  â€œWhy Cassy? It doesnâ€™t sound like a manâ€™s name at allâ€ I ask   â€œHmm I suppose it does not however I believe thatâ€™s why it suits you even moreâ€ she responds   â€œOh? What is that supposed to mean?â€ I question her again   â€œNothing important Father wants to speak to you.â€ She replied   Cutting my conversation with Laena I begin to look for my father to find him in the Maesters room.      Third Person View  Caserys walked into the room to find his father sitting down looking towards the ocean with the Maester whispering into his ear.  Once he had noticed Caserys he had called him to move forward.  â€œHello my sonâ€ Corlys started   â€œHello fatherâ€ Caserys replied   â€œMy son tell me what you know of Daemon Targaryenâ€  â€œWhy father?â€  â€œHe has notified me that he will aid our battle for the stepstones to reclaim our landâ€ Corlys smiled back somewhat twistedly   â€œIâ€™m sure you can guess he wants the crown he believes was taken from him. I suppose if helping you would rally your support in his cause I imagine he would.â€   â€œI gathered that but what of his interest in you. The crown wouldnâ€™t justify his sudden interest in your lifeâ€  â€œI havenâ€™t the slightest clue perhaps you should speak to him yourselfâ€  â€œWatch your tone Caserys I merely mean what of his plans require your help?â€   â€œForgive me Father for I do not knowâ€  â€œVery well understand that with our battle of the stepstones your help on dragon back will be most crucial. Laena hasnâ€™t bonded to a dragon and Rhaeraxes outweighs Seasmokeâ€  â€œI understand I will be readyâ€  â€œGoâ€     (Caserysâ€™ P.O.V)  After exiting my fatherâ€™s chambers I make my way outside the castle to find my dragon. To finally be able to see my dragon in the flesh.    Rhaeraxesâ€™ large body exits the sea caves from underneath the castle finding a new hiding spot from his rock.  As he approaches me I notice the large horns on each side of his face resembling Meleys. Rhaeraxesâ€™ three black horns on both sides dawing six horns.   He leans down his face right next to my body. As I place my hands I feel the texture of his rough scales underneath my skin.  â€œWeâ€™re going to have to fight soon We just can not lose control againâ€¦â€  Rhaeraxes curls his head close to me finding comfort in my presence.   Yet feeling a different presence Rhaeraxes finishes his huddle into my body and then travels back into the sea caves just as Caraxes flies over Driftmark Castle.  â€œDaemonâ€™s war for the crown is going to kill usâ€¦â€     A/N Back from deadâ€¦ Feeling pretty good. Iâ€™m trying to speed these chapters along for season 2. This chapter is loosely based on Episode 2 but the next chapter will be more coherent and better attached to the timeline. For reference Rhaeraxes is around Drogonâ€™s size perhaps a little smaller so maybe more around Rhaegal. I also changed the spelling of Rayraxsâ€™ name to Rhaeraxes (again pronounced Ray-rax-sis). Seeing y'all soon loving you guys my ghost whores.

post_body: Giulia Targaryen: Introduction Born in Dragonstone on the second day of the eleventh month in 82 A.C. Giulia Targaryen was the second child of Crown Prince Aemon Targaryen and his wife Jocelyn Baratheon.   The infant was tiny at birth. Her cries were hardly audible. The maester and the midwife were concerned that the Stranger may be at the young princessâ€™s door when they saw the small child but as the days went by the little princess began to show signs of recovery which relieved people around her especially her parents.   The announcement of the sex of the baby created a wave of disappointment throughout the realm. They were expecting this child to be a boy an heir for the heir. The royal couple was delighted with the birth of their second daughter as if she were a boy including her paternal grandmother Queen Alysanne.   Princess Rhaenys then eight years old loved her little sister. For a long time she had begged and prayed for a sibling and her wishes and prayers were answered. Even though the two princesses were born a decade apart and with different personalities they were attached to the hip. If they were both in the Palace at the same time they would always be spotted together arms linked and giggling.   Princess Giulia also enjoyed a close bond with Corlys Velaryon her sisterâ€™s husband. The Seasnake used to lavish his little sister with expensive gifts. He bestowed upon her the moniker â€œGolden Princessâ€ because of the little childâ€™s fascination with all thingâ€™s gold.   The Princess had the basic education as her sister and other noble ladies. She was thought how to manage household duties Valyrian history art and embroidery and when she brought to the Queenâ€™s household it expanded even more. A dragon egg was laid on her crib just like many previous Targaryen children before her but it never hatched. She would ride Silverwing her grandmotherâ€™s dragon eighteen years later and three years before she became Queen.

of your faces.  â€œi love you too.â€ you pressed your forehead to his closing your eyes. â€œi canâ€™t become one of those things..â€  aegon closed his eyes and with his free hand brought his hand to post_body: My biggest complaint about House of the Dragon since I started it is wishing we could see more of the character dynamics play out. Idk if itâ€™s pressure to fit everything into ten 1 hr episodes(which they donâ€™t need to limit themselves to in the first place) but I just want to see more of these relationships and characters because theyâ€™re all so interesting. Ex: Harwin and Rhaenyra barely interact for 3 minutes of total screen time despite having 3 children+ I feel like the writers have to force themselves to make Helaena have a moment with either of her brothers as if she and Aegon didnâ€™t loose a son together and Aemond wasnâ€™t the indirect cause of that sons death.

post_body: chemical override (4)  Ewan Mitchell x actress!reader series masterlist â–ªï¸ main masterlist   Ewan wants to clear things up about the night out and his mystery companion and the reader gets another surprise in LA. Will the two finally have their first date or will something get in the way once more?  <!-- more --> Ewanâ€™s publicist Donna has never had any issue with her client before. Always present and accounted for on time for whatever interview photoshoot or audition he has booked for the day.   But she hasnâ€™t been able to get a hold of him in the past two days which is worrying her to no end because he is set to meet with a major casting director in New York some time in the coming week.  Donna may have a clue as to why. Itâ€™s only been two days as well since the pub incident when The Sun ran a story speculating on Ewanâ€™s lovelife - the exact kind of thing heâ€™s always been trying to avoid.   It had taken a life of its own with fans taking it upon themselves to track down every clue of the girl on the internet. Her instagram. Her relation to the cast - apparently she is a cousin of Luke and Elliott. Even the marketing agency where she works. Louise a 26-year old graphic designer admittedly harbours a crush on Ewan and when she heard that her cousins were hanging out with him at a pub nearby she almost immediately invited herself and her friends over.   But thatâ€™s all according to Ewan. After talking to Luke memories of the night came rushing back to him.   Stumbling out in the alley to send you that voice message. Rejoining the boys to see that theyâ€™ve got new company. Being introduced to Louise with Tom joking that he should be careful with the missus. Wouldnâ€™t want her - you - to think that heâ€™s flirting with anyone else.   Even though thatâ€™s exactly what happened. Not the flirting per se. Not from Ewanâ€™s side at least. Louise had been brazen with admiration barely leaving his side the rest of the night. Asking him a bunch of probing questions he had neither the interest nor the patience to answer.   They had all thought the pub was safe from prying eyes. No one approached them for anything not even a single look of recognition followed by the question â€œAre you that guy from House of the Dragon?â€ Unfortunately it only takes one rat for a headline to surface. Ewan Mitchellâ€™s mystery girl has been the talk of the fandom and Donna has been trying hard to quell the rumours.   Such is the nasty nature of the business as she knows Ewan has quickly learned.   She dials him again and to her surprise the call actually patches through.  Her clientâ€™s throaty voice is heard on the other line â€œHey Donna sorry if Iâ€™ve missed your calls.â€  â€œItâ€™s alright itâ€™s alright Ewanâ€ Donna stammers. â€œJust glad to hear from you. Where are you? Iâ€™ve managed to do some damage control about those rumours and - â€  â€œOh Iâ€™m in LA. I just landed about an hour agoâ€ Ewan responds casually not mirroring the stress in Donnaâ€™s tone. Has he gotten over the fuss so easily?  â€œLA? You know your meeting is not till next week right? And itâ€™s in New York. Itâ€™s very very important that you donâ€™t miss it Ewan.â€  â€œAnd I wonâ€™tâ€ Ewan affirms laughing dryly to console his worried publicist. â€œI just need to see about something over here.â€   Someone he thinks. Heâ€™s got his priorities straight.  â€œWork-related?â€ Donna asks curious.  â€œUhhhmâ€ Ewan dithers but decides against telling her about you. Not just yet. â€œJust visiting a friend. Iâ€™ll stay here for a while then fly out to New York donâ€™t worry.â€  â€œOkay just keep in touch alright? Iâ€™ll send more details about the meeting soon.â€  â€œSure thing. Thank you Donna.â€   â€œTalk soon Ewan. Take care of yourself.â€  Donna feels a huge sense of relief wash over her when the call ends knowing the whereabouts of one of her biggest clients. But why LA? Perhaps Ewan just needed some time off after the flurry of annoying headlines put out in the UK.  Or maybe heâ€™s visiting with a friend? Who is stateside right now? Fabienâ€™s filming in Philly. The rest of the boys are still in England. But thenâ€¦  Her thoughts land on the one thing - the one person - that would make him fly out on such short notice. Without giving thought to anything else especially after the speculation on his romantic life.  Ewanâ€™s never been one to share about personal affairs not even to his close-knit team but no matter how reclusive he is no one can deny the way he looks at you. The way he lights up when youâ€™re brought up in conversation. The number of times he had excused himself from their meetings to make a call standing in the corner with a permanent smile etched on his face.   Oh Donna knows now just who he is in LA for.   â–ªï¸ â–ªï¸ â–ªï¸ â–ªï¸ â–ªï¸ â–ªï¸ â–ªï¸  Like inevitable spectres haunting someone of his profession Ewan noticed the papparazzi snapping away as he arrived in LA.   He told no one he would be coming so it must be an automatic thing in the city. The photogs are always scurrying in the periphery ready to catch anyone of note no matter the degree of fame or notoriety.  If you were keeping up with such news you would know he is in the city.   But according to your assistant Clara who was kind enough to inform him of your schedule you are still finishing up on another day of rehearsals for your upcoming rom-com. Ewan checked in the same hotel as you planning to seek you out as soon as you arrive back from work.  He hasnâ€™t spoken to you since the voicemail and since those false news broke out. Not that he can blame you - wouldnâ€™t anyone be suspicious of a drunken confession made by a guy who was allegedly in the company of another girl?  He hates it being subject to all of this. This nonsense that is keeping you from him not even worth any consequence.  But he will deal with the blows. As long as he sets things right with you. As long he gets you in the end.   He settles in his suite getting ready to meet with you once more. He showers shaves tousles his hair. He even checks whether he smells decent after all of that - once twice and another time. Being nervous to stand in front of a crowd is one thing; itâ€™s a whole other conundrum for him finally see you again.   Maybe the crowds are more manageable and it baffles him to realise so. He can put on a persona be the actor and disappear inside himself as the cameras flash bright enough for him to disassociate.  But not with you. He wants to show you everything that he is who he truly is and it scares him. There is no team to help him get ready now. Itâ€™s all him just Ewan.   Clad in his trusty black jeans and a comfortable hoodie of the same dark colour he looks in the mirror one last time after receiving a text from Clara that youâ€™ve arrived at the hotel about half an hour ago.  He contemplates opening the bottle of bourbon from the minibar and taking a shot of liquid courage - something to help him get his explanation ready. Just so he wouldnâ€™t stammer in front of you.   Just so you he can make you see without any error or trace of doubt that he meant every word in that voicemail no matter how embarrassing it might have sounded.  He decides against it imagining the wrinkling of your nose as you catch a whiff of the alcohol. Itâ€™s cute when you do it and he adores it so dearly but he knows that it isnâ€™t the right moment.  He rights himself rolls his shoulders and heâ€™s out the door.   â–ªï¸ â–ªï¸ â–ªï¸ â–ªï¸ â–ªï¸ â–ªï¸ â–ªï¸  Jacob trails you inside your hotel suite laughing at some shared remark about the scenes you rehearsed for the day.  They were emotionally demanding and even after tossing around ideas for hours the two of you were unable to achieve a satisfying approach to the scenes.  Which is why he had proposed practicing well into the evening and you found yourselves heading back to your suite together. He has his own house in LA but your hotel just happened to be closer to the rehearsal studio.   â€œCare for a drink?â€ you asked him.  â€œWhy the hell not?â€ he immediately assents in that easy Aussie drawl. â€œWe might need it for this shite.â€  You laugh in agreement â€œIndeed. Iâ€™ve got some canned gin and tonics if thatâ€™s alright.. or beerâ€¦ or whiskeyâ€¦ â€ you trail off as you study the contents of your fridge.  â€œG and t please mateâ€ he settles down on the couch legs stretching in front of him. â€œWe were so unproductive today. I just could not get that line right.â€  â€œTell me about it.â€ You hand him his drink and he clinks it with yours with a mumbled cheers. â€œIt was me who canâ€™t land the right toneâ€ you say. â€œI mean is my character supposed to be confused in that moment? Or angry? Or sad?â€  â€œOr all of â€˜em.â€ he shrugs. â€œTricky isnâ€™t it?â€  You hurriedly fetch your script from a table getting right down to it. â€œSo for the first scene in the third actâ€¦â€   Moments later with cans of gin and tonic discarded on the coffee table you and Jacob sit with legs crossed on the couch facing each other. Scripts in hand you go through the lines over and over with only seemingly minor tweaks each time. To an actor though even just the slightest change of pitch or expression makes all the difference.  â€œIs that better? I think we almost got itâ€ you say after a read-through.   â€œYeah so much betterâ€ he grins holding his hand up for a high-five. Just as your hands smack in the air another sound echoes faintly from the door.   â€œSomeoneâ€™s knocking?â€ Jacob asks. â€œYou expecting anybody? Room service or anything?â€  â€œNoâ€ you shake your head trying to think of whether your assistant or publicist said anything about dropping by. â€œMaybe itâ€™s just housekeeping?â€  â€œIâ€™ll get itâ€ Jacob states already padding his way to the door.  A beat later you hear Jacob loudly exclaim â€œEwan mate! Itâ€™s good to see you!â€  Ewan? A shiver runs up your spine. Craning your neck to get a view of a doorway you catch sight of him half-obscured by Jacobâ€™s tall frame.   Confused surprised and feeling some other emotion you canâ€™t pinpoint you head over to greet him.   â€œHow are you doing?â€ Jacob greets shaking Ewanâ€™s hand oblivious to the poorly hidden distaste in his eyes.   â€œWh-what are you doing here?â€ Ewan finds himself asking Jacob a bit rudely just as you ask him the same.   â€œWhat are you doing here?â€ you mirror his question at the exact same time.  â€œOh!â€ Jacob breathes out a laugh â€œWell Iâ€™ll go first. We were just practicing lines.â€  â€œIn her room? Isnâ€™t it a bit late for rehearsal? I thought youâ€™re supposed to be off work.â€ Ewan asks and it sounds like an accusation. He starts to feel all kinds of uneasy - were the twins right about life imitating art?   You narrow your eyes at him. â€œWe decided to continue running lines after rehearsal. Thereâ€™s a scene we canâ€™t get right. Itâ€™s quite tricky - â€  â€œJust the two of you? Alone here?â€ Ewan tilts his head gesturing towards the room like itâ€™s some forbidden place.  Jacob shakes his head smile steady on his lips. If heâ€™s caught on to how Ewan must be feeling he doesnâ€™t let it affect him. He gives you a look as if to check your reaction and you give him a reassuring shrug.  Ewan does not overlook this exchange. He clenches his jaw irate from the assumptions popping up in his mind. Before he forgets his manners he says â€œExcuse me I justâ€¦ wasnâ€™t expectingâ€¦ I just wanted to speak to you.â€  â€œI didnâ€™t even know you were in LAâ€ you say before moving aside to usher him in. â€œBut Iâ€™m glad you are of course. Come join us - â€  He nods making his way to the seating area where he spies the discarded cans of alcohol and dog-eared scripts. Maybe he should have taken that bloody shot after all.   He laughs joylessly to himself shaking his head. â€œSorry you guys. I just flew in today and I must have been exhausted from the flight.â€  â€œHey no worries mateâ€ Jacob says. â€œYou know what Iâ€™ll be on my way. Give you time to catch up and all.â€ He picks up his own tattered script then gives you a kiss on the cheek bidding you with a â€œIâ€™ll see you tomorrow. Have a good night sweetheart.â€   If looks could kill and if his dear mother hadnâ€™t raised him right he would have incinerated Jacob in that moment.   He is snapped out of his thoughts when Jacob claps him on the shoulder â€œGreat to see you again mate. Have a good night eh?â€  Ewan knows heâ€™s being ridiculous. Thereâ€™s nothing wrong with two friends and co-stars spending some time alone to rehearse. Besides last he heard you were adamant that you and Jacob are just friends.   So why is he being so irrational? Why does the idea of you spending more time than necessary with Jacob possibly falling for him bother him so much?   Ewan realises that this is what jealousy must feel like.   Heâ€™s had career envy before. Another actor landing a role he vied for. Someone else getting the praise he deserves.   But nothing like this. Itâ€™s petty and possessive.   He wants you to just be his.   You stand in front of him once more after you walk Jacob out of the suite.   â€œHeyâ€ you say smiling weakly.   â€œHi darling.â€  Both of you want to do more. Say more. Usually you would greet each other with a hug and a kiss on a cheek his hands lingering on your forearms even after you pull away but the air is thick with tension.  You look at him with those bright expecting eyes of yours and Ewan just wants to cave in and make a sloppy confession. But not after that voicemail no. Heâ€™s determined to do this right. Words not slurred head clear.   â€œSo I got your voicemailâ€ you finally say smiling coyly. â€œThat wasâ€¦ something.â€  â€œHmmâ€ he canâ€™t help but mirror your smile as always. â€œIt was wasnâ€™t it?â€  â€œI understandâ€ you continue taking a step closer â€œif you were drunk. We all say things when weâ€™re off it that we maybe donâ€™t mean - â€  â€œBut darling I meant every wordâ€ he says way too quickly.   You laugh the sound of it erasing whatever apprehension remained in him. â€œDo you even remember what you said?â€  â€œI doâ€ he counters moving even closer to you. Another step and heâ€™d be able to wrap his arms around your waist and pull you to him. â€œAt least some of - no - most of it.â€  â€œOh yeah?â€ you ask cheekily aided by the effect of gin. He still has your heart racing but a part of you now knows that the feeling is mutual. â€œWhat did you say again?â€   He sees that glint in your eye and it causes him to smirk. â€œWhy donâ€™t I make it simple for you darling?â€ He closes the distance one hand brushing the hair from your face.   â€œOkayâ€ you swallow getting lost in his blues.   â€œI missed you.â€ He kisses your cheek. â€œI like you. A lot.â€ He kisses the other. â€œAnd I uh I would like to take you on a date.â€  His eyes meet yours. His voice is steady but you notice some nervousness in his gaze. How the tables have turned. You make Ewan Mitchellâ€™s heart go awry.   â€œPlease darling?â€ he timidly adds the sentiment so sweet you want to blurt out yes immediately. Before you can heâ€™s already leaned back an explanation rushing out of his lips â€œAndâ€¦ Iâ€™m not sure but you must have seen those headlines? Theyâ€™re not true I swear. We were out drinking and - â€  â€œI know Ewan.â€ You cut him off with a hand pressed gently on his chest but he keeps going.   â€œ - some other people joined us. One of them being - â€  â€œLuke and Elliottâ€™s cousin. I know. Elliott called and told me everything.â€  â€œOh. He called you?â€ A huge sense of relief washes over him better than any comfort he might have found in a shot or three of bourbon.   â€œMhmm he called me yesterday. So you know you didnâ€™t really have to fly out. I was about to call you eventually.â€  He smiles bashfully eyes cast down as a blush spreads across his cheeks. Damn it Elliott you brilliant lad. He reminds himself to treat Elliott to a pint the next time he sees him.   â€œI still wanted to see youâ€ Ewan maintains pressing a kiss to your forehead and youâ€™re immediately enveloped by the familiar comfort of his scent. Surprisingly without the staple hint of cigarette smoke due to his frantic scrubbing after the flight.   â€œIâ€™m happy youâ€™re hereâ€ you say wrapping your arms around his waist cheek pressed against his chest. â€œAnd no offence to Louise or anything but she needs to learn some boundaries with my - â€  Ewan looks down at you fondly squeezing your arms to prompt your next words â€œYeah darling? Your what?â€  â€œMy - â€ you attempt to bury your face in his hoodie but he keeps your gaze with a hand cupping your jaw. So you end up saving yourself with â€œ - my Aemond.â€  â€œHmmâ€ he hums lips curling and itâ€™s so very Aemond of him it makes you feel warm all over. â€œYour Aemond.Your Ewan. Iâ€™m all yours love.â€  The whole thing couldnâ€™t have gone any better all things considered and Ewan feels content to have gotten over his first brush with the rumour mill. What matters is right in front of him and you know the truth.   â€œAre you staying in this hotel? How did you even know I was here?â€ You take his hand guiding him over to the couch.  â€œClaraâ€ is all Ewan says by way of explanation.  â€œWell thank you Claraâ€ you declare. Ewan shuffles closer to you and rests his arm around your shoulders planting a kiss on your forehead again. The gesture is already becoming instinctive providing the both of you with a sense of ease.  â€œDarling?â€  â€œYeah?â€ you respond absentmindedly fingers toying with the soft fabric of his hoodie.   â€œIs that a yes?â€  You exhale deeply. As if it wasnâ€™t clear enough already. â€œWhat do you think handsome?â€  â€œI donâ€™t know angel. You tell meâ€ he counters cheekily his fingers playing with your hair as you playfully glare at him.  â€œWhat if I say no baby?â€  â€œThen Iâ€™ll have to work hard to change your mind princess.â€  â€œAnd how would you do that honey?â€  His gaze darkens and something flashes across his blue eyes as he whispers intensely â€œUse your imagination bunny.â€   â€œRi-rightâ€ you bite your lip then shake your head to snap out of it. â€œWeâ€™ll have to draw the line at bunny.â€  He laughs at your flustered state pleased by the effect he has on you. â€œWhatâ€™s wrong with bunny?â€  That elicits a groan out of you but you smile anyway. â€œI already said yes Ewan. Quit it with the bunny.â€  â€œAlright beautifulâ€ he relents making you lean even closer against him.   The haze of gin after a long work day starts to subside and the rush of emotion is coming back to you. You find yourself gazing at Ewan in mild disbelief in awe that he just confessed that he wants you.   Feeling antsy you stand and pace around the room. You start tidying things putting your scattered knick-knacks back in your handbag. If you sit with him any longer you just might end up hurrying things through and jump his bones already kiss him the next time he does that hmm.   â€œCan I get you anything?â€ you ask.   â€œNoâ€ he says smoothly. â€œI just need you.â€ The words make you stop in your tracks. He still sits in the same position looking at you with that undeniable desire in his eyes.  â€œUhhhmâ€ your mouth feels dry all of the sudden. Nothing his tongue past your lips canâ€™t fix your intrusive thoughts barge right in. â€œSoâ€¦ theâ€¦ the media rolloutâ€™s still going on isnâ€™t it? Should we check and see?â€ You take your laptop and plop back down next to him. He doesnâ€™t miss a beat and cuddles against you once more wrapping his arm around your tense frame.   â€œI think so darling.â€ The media rollout is how the interviews and promotional material filmed by the cast is being released gradually on a weekly basis after each new episode comes out.   A simple search on Youtube confirms it and the first thing that popped up is the Where is The Lie? video you did for Elle.   It was slated for just Tom Phia and Ewan but your Blackwood character became such a fan-favourite that they asked you to join in. Not to mention the frenzy you and Ewan caused online with the initial interviews you did together.   â€œShall we watch this?â€ Ewan offers solely for the intent of seeing you in the video.  You click on it and for the next 8 minutes or so all you can take note of are the signs that had clearly already been there. The fans were on to something when they claimed that you and Ewan are a really good ship.   The video starts with a clip of Phia hitting her head on the overhead lamp when she stands prompting her to uncontrollably giggle along with you and Tom. Ewan being the exception is beside himself with worry and he appears to instinctively reach for your hand as you sit beside him.   â€œHuhâ€ Ewan smiles taking your hand and pressing a kiss to the back of it.   Tom is the first to be put on the hot seat and he slowly recites the three statements he prepared. â€œEwan pay attentionâ€ Tom blurts out when he notices that Ewan kept sneaking glances at you. â€œSure Iâ€™m locked inâ€ Ewan says right back as you and Phia share a look.   â€œWhat were you looking at?â€ you ask playfully poking him in the side. â€œYou seem plenty distracted there.â€  He snorts at himself in the video when he ends up smiling as he caught your eye. â€œIt was your fault. You were distracting me.â€  â€œI was not!â€ you exclaim. â€œI thought you were just being competitive then.â€  Phia is next to have a go. She tells you of a Wifi repellent necklace a wrestling career and saving a squirrel from a drainpipe. â€œThe Wifi thing sounds like something Ewan would haveâ€ Tom jokes. â€œOh sureâ€ you concur â€œexcept that heâ€™d actually keep it so he can watch films.â€ Ewan smiles at your acute observation.   â€œIâ€™d also keep it to stalk your Instagramâ€ Ewan mumbles from beside you. â€œAnd you know just stalk you in general.â€  â€œIâ€™m sure you do Mitchellâ€ you respond casually but your face warms up anyhow.   Itâ€™s Ewanâ€™s turn and as he sits on the hot seat you see Tom and Phia casting a look at each other then at the two of you a secret message shared between them. â€œI bet she will know the answer right awayâ€ Phia says. â€œYeah how do we know the two of you didnâ€™t conspire together?â€ Tom asks. â€œAre you kidding me you guys?â€ you laugh at them thinking how silly they were being not knowing then that they were definitely on to something.   â€œDarling you have to know thisâ€ Ewan tells you specifically as you all try to guess the answer. â€œOh darling!â€ Tom mouths to Phia dramatically flipping nonexistent long hair over his shoulder. Phia laughs at his antics before nudging you and saying â€œWhich one is it? Which is the lie? I trust you.â€ You respond â€œWhy me? You two should know this too!â€  â€œBecause I wasnâ€™t trying to date them my loveâ€ Ewan says smiling at the screen.   â€œOh come on now.â€ You crane your neck up to press a soft kiss against his cheek before turning your attention back to the video. So you donâ€™t notice the switch in Ewanâ€™s breathing. The jumps in his heartbeart. The way he subtly clears his throat to deal with his flustered state.  The video comes to a close after your turn and even at the very end Ewan can be seen admiring you as you give the closing remarks with Phia.  Admiring you as he does in the moment.   â€œYouâ€™re beautiful you know that?â€ he says when you turn to look at him.   â€œThank youâ€ you reply softly your voice barely audible.   Some time passes with the two of you catching up talking about your upcoming projects his big meeting in New York - all the while his fingers trace patterns on your exposed skin his arm wrapped around you snugly.   â€œHave you been keeping up with the show?â€ he asks.  â€œThe last episode I saw fully wasâ€¦ the second one? I got pretty busy after that. How about you?â€  â€œOhâ€ he looks down in thought piquing your curiosity â€œso you didnâ€™t get to see the third episode yet then?â€  â€œNo not yetâ€ you shake your head â€œbut Iâ€™ve seen some stuff here and there.â€  He hums again and he wants to ask have you seen his stuff? There are around a dozen or so potential jokes at play here. He has an inkling to tell you to watch the episode so you can see just what youâ€™re in for. So you can see him and all he has to offer. Heâ€™d also fumble through a justification as he had done in some interview about the new studio they had filmed in being cold as a fridge freezer.  What to say? What to say? He picks at some lint on his jeans smirking to himself.   â€œYeahâ€ you eventually giggle at his obvious hesitation. â€œIâ€™ve only seen some of the episode. But what Iâ€™ve seenâ€¦ is enough to make me jealous of Madame Sylvie.â€  He stiffens throat suddenly dry but one look at your smile does away with his concerns.   He soon finds himself laughing a muffled â€œOh darlingâ€ whispered lovingly against your hair.  â€œThat was very brave of you Ewanâ€ you express sincerely.   â€œThank you love.â€  â€œSoâ€¦ just how cold was it in there?â€  Your shared unrestrained laughter echo throughout the room.   â–ªï¸ â–ªï¸ â–ªï¸ â–ªï¸ â–ªï¸ â–ªï¸ â–ªï¸  Your first date was meant to happen the following night but such is the nature of the job that Ewanâ€™s schedule gets moved up all of a sudden.  Once the bigshot casting director in New York found out that Ewan is already stateside he requested that the meeting be held at the earliest possible opportunity.  He calls you while you are in rehearsals profusely apologizing and promising to fly back to LA in the next two days right after his meeting is all sorted.  â€œItâ€™s okay Ewanâ€ you reassure him genuinely understanding. â€œI will see you when you come back. Good luck I know youâ€™re going to smash it whatever opportunity this is!â€  â€œThank you darlingâ€ he says already wanting to have you back in his arms already mentally kicking himself for not kissing you when he had about a hundred chances to do so. â€œIâ€™m going to miss you.â€  â€œIâ€™ll miss you tooâ€ you respond blushing silly with the phone pressed to your ear. â€œBut itâ€™ll only be two days.â€  â€œHmm doesnâ€™t matter. I need to take you on our bloody date darling. Iâ€™ve already taken so damn long.â€  â€œDonâ€™t worryâ€ you say â€œIâ€™ve already seen you way more than I should before the first date.â€  â€œWha - â€ a protest forms on his lips but he gets your point right away. â€œOh. Clever darling.â€  â€œI know.â€  â€œBut Iâ€™m planning to give you something thatâ€™s just for you. That the whole world wonâ€™t ever be privy to.â€  You swallow hard your very being heating up at his insinuation. â€œDonâ€™t make promises you canâ€™t keep Mitchell.â€  â€œI guess youâ€™ll just have to wait and see.â€  Bonus chapter! post_body: Okay so I may be barking up the wrong tree but what if Rhaenysâ€™s conversation with Corlys regarding Alyn actually breaks her heart a bit because she now knows what else heâ€™s been dealing with.   No doubt she felt Corlys pull away she knows something isnâ€™t right she feels increasingly more and more isolated from him. And now she knows why: heâ€™s been dealing with this - the fact that his bastard son saved his life and heâ€™s been trying to keep it from her (not knowing that even if she didnâ€™t know Alyn saved Corlysâ€™s life he does exist).   Is this why you came? To subject me to an inquisition?  That flash of anger the accusation he throws at her is probably the most heâ€™s actually given to her unfiltered all season. His blood has never heated before then. But itâ€™s in there that she finds honesty. Itâ€™s in Corlysâ€™s anger always that Rhaenys is able to find vulnerability. Heâ€™s anticipating her reaction. Heâ€™s defensive against her reaction because heâ€™s thought about what this truth could possibly do to them. Like a wounded animal striking out.  Rhaenys has known heâ€™s been wounded. She knows heâ€™s not been right. And itâ€™s not all to do with this of course. But this is the thing she didnâ€™t know heâ€™d been dealing with. She knew about all the othe griefs and insecurities.  And she just looks at him. Because the puzzle pieces have slotted into place and even though Rhaenys is hurting and this does (absolutely) hurt herâ€¦ she can see it hurts him as well and itâ€™s been hurting him for a long time.

post_body: TOM GLYNN-CARNEY INTERVIEWED FOR VESTAL MAGAZINE.   REFLECTING ON YOUR JOURNEY IN THE ACTING INDUSTRY DO YOU REMEMBER THE MOMENT YOU REALIZED YOU REALIZED YOU WANTED TO PURSUE ACTING?  â€œThe moment I realized I wanted to pursue acting was probably when I was around 12 years old in high school.â€ â€œI was performing in a production of Shakespeareâ€™s Macbeth at the Royal Exchange in Manchester.â€ â€œI saw older actors and wondered what their "properâ€ jobs were outside of the theater.â€œ â€˜When I asked one of them they saidâ€™: â€” "No this is my proper job. This is what I do.â€ â€œI didnâ€™t know people could do that.â€ â€œFrom that moment on I knew that this is what I wanted to do as a career.â€ YOUâ€™VE DONE MULTIPLE SHOWS AND MOVIES IN THE DRAMATIC GENRE. WOULD YOU EVER BE OPEN TO DOING OTHER GENRES?  â€œAbsolutely Iâ€™d love to explore new genres in the future.â€ â€œIâ€™d love to give comedy a go.â€ â€œI think that would be a good challenge.â€ â€œItâ€™s difficult because timing is crucial delivering a joke at the right time can feel almost mathematical.â€ â€œBut I think that good comedy actors donâ€™t see it that way at all.â€ â€œIt just comes naturally to them.â€ â€œIâ€™d love to give it a shot.â€ â€œIâ€™m also interested in doing biopics bringing real-life stories to life.â€ â€œChet Baker and Gene Kelly in particular would be fascinating characters to portray.â€ â€œBut Iâ€™m open to any interesting projects that come my way.â€ HOW DO YOU CHOOSE THE ROLES YOU TAKE ON? ARE YOU DRAWN TO A PARTICULAR TYPE OF CHARACTER OR STORY?  â€œHonestly Iâ€™m drawn to anything that makes me feel uncomfortable and pushes me out of my comfort zone.â€ â€œI seek out roles where the character feels distant and challenging.â€ â€œI like to test myself and see if I can bring such characters to life.â€ â€œIf a role feels like something I might struggle with thatâ€™s exactly what I want to tackle.â€ â€œI often joke that these challenging roles might be my downfall someday.â€ laughs CAN YOU SHARE ANY INSIGHTS INTO HOW YOUR CHARACTER AEGON II TARGARYEN ENVOLVES IN THE UPCOMING SEASON?  â€œI found it fascinating to delve deeper into Aegon this season because thereâ€™s so much more to uncover about him.â€ â€œIn the first season we saw quite a two-dimensional view of Aegonâ€”not due to Ty Tennantâ€™s portrayal which I thought was fantastic bringing a lot of vulnerability and teenage angst to the character.â€ â€œWhen I took over the time frame was too short to really explore Aegonâ€™s complexities.â€ â€œThis time Iâ€™ve had an extended period to sit with the character and dig into his deeper layers.â€ â€œPlaying a character experiencing profound grief is always a challenge.â€ â€œIâ€™m lucky enough that Iâ€™ve never gone through anything like that myself so I had to imagine it as vividly as possible.â€ â€œThis season Aegon is shown as more of an empath than a psychopath.â€ â€œIt becomes clear that he has the capacity to love feel and grieve.â€ â€œThere are so many comparisons between Aegon and Richard II.â€ â€œPeople are saying Aegon is cold calculated and evil and while heâ€™s certainly done horrible thingsâ€”Iâ€™m not justifying any of thoseâ€”itâ€™s important to note that rather than being a straightforward villain heâ€™s a crumbling tragedy.â€ HOW HAS YOUR APPROACH TO PORTRAYING AEGON II CHANGED FROM THE PREVIOUS SEASON TO THE NEW ONE?  â€œThereâ€™s definitely a continuation of the drama and theatricality from season one.â€ â€œItâ€™s huge rousing and intense.â€ â€œIâ€™ve seen episodes one to four and they are just unbelievable especially the battle scenes â€” you canâ€™t get any bigger than that.â€ â€œThis season though thereâ€™s also an element of humor.â€ â€œAt some point they called Aegon 'the Magnanimousâ€™ and it was important to bring some levity to his character.â€ â€œAegon has just stepped into the role of King and is trying to figure it all out.â€ â€œWeâ€™re at a point where heâ€™s found a spring in his step enjoying this new responsibility and purpose.â€ â€œHeâ€™s also got a lot of power now.â€ â€œPower can go to peopleâ€™s heads and make them crazy.â€ â€œIt was nice to explore his boyishness and playfulness as it gives his character more depth and leaves room for growth.â€ WHAT WOULD YOU TELL PEOPLE TO GET THEM ON TEAM GREEN?  â€œI donâ€™t think I need to persuade themâ€”obviously weâ€™re the best.â€ â€œBut if you really want to see why this season is packed with surprises that will make it clear.â€ SINCE THE SHOW IS BASED ORIGINALLY ON BOOKS IS THERE A SPECIFIC BOOK YOUâ€™D LIKE TO SEE BROUGHT TO THE SCREEN AND FOR YOU TO BE A PART OF?  â€œIâ€™d love to see a film adaptation of Douglas Stuartâ€™s book Shuggie Bain.â€ â€œAnother great choice would be The Thousand Autumns of Jacob de Zoet by David Mitchell.â€ â€œItâ€™s a collection of beautiful and heart-wrenching short stories and each one could make a compelling film.â€ â€œLooking at my bookshelf now I see a lot of books on Bob Dylan David Bowie and Paul McCartneyâ€”mostly singer-songwriters.â€ â€œI also have a lot of poetry. Iâ€™d love to see a biopic of Patti Smith.â€ â€œThat would be incredible.â€ YOUR CAREER HAS TAKEN YOU TO VARIOUS FILMING LOCATIONS AROUND THE WORLD. IS THERE A SPECIFIC LOCATION YOU HAVENâ€™T BEEN TO YET AND WOULD LOVE TO BE THE BACKDROP FOR A POTENTIAL FUTURE PROYECT?  â€œOh thatâ€™s a good question.â€ â€œI think somewhere thatâ€™s a hybrid between beautiful rolling countryside and the coast.â€ â€œA place that offers both stunning landscapes and the sea.â€ â€œOn your days off you could go for a swim or hike through the mountains.â€ â€œIâ€™d love to work in a scenic and peaceful location like that.â€ SOMETIMES ACTORS WHO PLAY 'VILLAINSâ€™ CAN GET AN ADVERSE REACTION FROM SOME FANS OF A SHOW. WHAT HAVE YOUR INTERACTIONS BEEN LIKE?  â€œIâ€™ve been very lucky.â€ â€œMany people have approached me with kind words about my portrayal of Aegon.â€ â€œItâ€™s a challenging task to humanize someone so seemingly poisonous.â€ â€œFortunately I havenâ€™t had negative encounters with fans who canâ€™t differentiate between the character and the actor.â€ â€œI think weâ€™re in a different phase in society now.â€ â€œWhen Jack Gleeson played Joffrey there was less social media presence making it harder for audiences to separate the actor from the character.â€ â€œToday I think we are a more technologically advanced community with more behind-the-scenes and a better understanding of the distinction between actor and character.â€ â€œI think people have copped on. I hope thatâ€™s the case anyway.â€ YOUâ€™VE COLLABORATED WITH RENOWNED DIRECTORS LIKE CHRISTOPHER NOLAN. WHAT HAVE YOU LEARNED FROM THESE EXPERIENCES?  â€œDoing Dunkirk was my first significant experience on a film set.â€ â€œI really didnâ€™t know where to start.â€ â€œThe canvas was completely blank.â€ â€œAnd it was just such a gift a pinch me moment that I was able to learn from some of if not the best filmmaker in the world.â€ â€œIt was overwhelming.â€ â€œAnd I had to remind myself to be present and soak in everything like a sponge.â€ â€œChrisâ€™s patience and the support from the rest of the cast were invaluable throughout.â€ â€œWe were all in it together especially us young lads who were new to such a big production.â€ â€œWe learned and grew together during that incredible experience.â€ IN THE KING YOU PORTRAYED A HISTORICAL FIGURE. HOW DID YOU APPROACH BRINGING THIS CHARACTER TO LIFE?  â€œWhen portraying a fictional character thereâ€™s often more freedom because thereâ€™s no definitive blueprint to followâ€”even if theyâ€™re written in a book theyâ€™re still fictional.â€ â€œYou can infuse your own understanding and personality into the role.â€ â€œHowever thereâ€™s added pressure when it comes to a historical figure because youâ€™re portraying someone real.â€ â€œI never let that pressure overwhelm or hinder the process.â€ â€œInstead I took the character as presented and focused on doing my best with the role.â€ A NEW HUNGER GAMES MOVIE WAS JUST ANNOUNCED SPECIFICALLY A PREQUEL FOCUSING ON HAYMITCHâ€™S STORY AND MANY FANS ARE EAGER TO SEE YOU IN THAT ROLE. WHAT ARE YOUR THOUGHTS ON THAT?  â€œNo way thatâ€™s the first Iâ€™ve heard of it! But Iâ€™m incredibly flattered that people would like to see me on screen again.â€ â€œIf all goes well Iâ€™ll fight for my life in the Hunger Games!â€ laugh WHAT ARE SOME OF YOUR FAVORITE SHOWS DURING YOUR DOWNTIME?  â€œOne show I watch repeatedly and it never gets old for me is the UK version of The Office.â€ â€œThe humor is very relatable and comforting to me.â€ â€œI even laugh just thinking about it. Itâ€™s one of those TV shows when it finishes youâ€™re like: â€” â€œOh no! What do I do with my life? I miss the characters already.â€ laugh "I also enjoy the US version of The Office.â€ â€œBesides that Iâ€™m fascinated by farming documentaries.â€ â€œShows like This Farming Life on BBC are incredibly calming for me.â€ â€œAnd I have to mention The Great Pottery Throwdown â€” Iâ€™m a bit of a pottery nerd and that show is brilliant! WHO ARE SOME CREATIVES YOU WOULD LOVE TO WORK WITH IN THE FUTURE?  "The list is long.â€ â€œFirstly there are directors Iâ€™d love to collaborate with again like Chris Nolan and Sam Mendes with whom Iâ€™ve had some of my best experiences and whom I consider friends.â€ â€œIâ€™m eager to work with them again.â€ â€œThen there are filmmakers like Andrea Arnold Yorgos Lanthimos Greta Gerwig Paul Thomas Anderson and Ruben Ostlund all of whom I admire and would love to collaborate with.â€ â€œWhen it comes to actors there are many I admire as well.â€ â€œI plan to work with individuals who challenge me from whom I can learn and who are dedicated to their craft.â€ â€œI appreciate those who find joy and humor in their work because life is short and itâ€™s important to enjoy what you do.â€ LASTLY WHERE DO YOU HOPE YOUR CAREER WILL HEAD INTO THE FUTURE?  â€œItâ€™s more of a feeling than a checklist of achievements that I aim for.â€ â€œI understand that feeling because I can almost sense it in advance.â€ â€œItâ€™s difficult to articulateâ€”itâ€™s a mix of happiness creative fulfillment diversity in roles consistent challenge and pushing boundaries.â€ â€œI aspire to transform and lose myself in characters.â€ â€œEqually important to me is collaborating with inspiring individuals whom I can learn from and grow with.â€ â€œI also value the freedom to select projects that resonate with me personally.â€

post_body: My biggest complaint about House of the Dragon since I started it is wishing we could see more of the character dynamics play out. Idk if itâ€™s pressure to fit everything into ten 1 hr episodes(which they donâ€™t need to limit themselves to in the first place) but I just want to see more of these relationships and characters because theyâ€™re all so interesting. Ex: Harwin and Rhaenyra barely interact for 3 minutes of total screen time despite having 3 children+ I feel like the writers have to force themselves to make Helaena have a moment with either of her brothers as if she and Aegon didnâ€™t loose a son together and Aemond wasnâ€™t the indirect cause of that sons death.
