post_body: chemical override (4)  Ewan Mitchell x actress!reader series masterlist â–ªï¸ main masterlist   Ewan wants to clear things up about the night out and his mystery companion and the reader gets another surprise in LA. Will the two finally have their first date or will something get in the way once more?  <!-- more --> Ewanâ€™s publicist Donna has never had any issue with her client before. Always present and accounted for on time for whatever interview photoshoot or audition he has booked for the day.   But she hasnâ€™t been able to get a hold of him in the past two days which is worrying her to no end because he is set to meet with a major casting director in New York some time in the coming week.  Donna may have a clue as to why. Itâ€™s only been two days as well since the pub incident when The Sun ran a story speculating on Ewanâ€™s lovelife - the exact kind of thing heâ€™s always been trying to avoid.   It had taken a life of its own with fans taking it upon themselves to track down every clue of the girl on the internet. Her instagram. Her relation to the cast - apparently she is a cousin of Luke and Elliott. Even the marketing agency where she works. Louise a 26-year old graphic designer admittedly harbours a crush on Ewan and when she heard that her cousins were hanging out with him at a pub nearby she almost immediately invited herself and her friends over.   But thatâ€™s all according to Ewan. After talking to Luke memories of the night came rushing back to him.   Stumbling out in the alley to send you that voice message. Rejoining the boys to see that theyâ€™ve got new company. Being introduced to Louise with Tom joking that he should be careful with the missus. Wouldnâ€™t want her - you - to think that heâ€™s flirting with anyone else.   Even though thatâ€™s exactly what happened. Not the flirting per se. Not from Ewanâ€™s side at least. Louise had been brazen with admiration barely leaving his side the rest of the night. Asking him a bunch of probing questions he had neither the interest nor the patience to answer.   They had all thought the pub was safe from prying eyes. No one approached them for anything not even a single look of recognition followed by the question â€œAre you that guy from House of the Dragon?â€ Unfortunately it only takes one rat for a headline to surface. Ewan Mitchellâ€™s mystery girl has been the talk of the fandom and Donna has been trying hard to quell the rumours.   Such is the nasty nature of the business as she knows Ewan has quickly learned.   She dials him again and to her surprise the call actually patches through.  Her clientâ€™s throaty voice is heard on the other line â€œHey Donna sorry if Iâ€™ve missed your calls.â€  â€œItâ€™s alright itâ€™s alright Ewanâ€ Donna stammers. â€œJust glad to hear from you. Where are you? Iâ€™ve managed to do some damage control about those rumours and - â€  â€œOh Iâ€™m in LA. I just landed about an hour agoâ€ Ewan responds casually not mirroring the stress in Donnaâ€™s tone. Has he gotten over the fuss so easily?  â€œLA? You know your meeting is not till next week right? And itâ€™s in New York. Itâ€™s very very important that you donâ€™t miss it Ewan.â€  â€œAnd I wonâ€™tâ€ Ewan affirms laughing dryly to console his worried publicist. â€œI just need to see about something over here.â€   Someone he thinks. Heâ€™s got his priorities straight.  â€œWork-related?â€ Donna asks curious.  â€œUhhhmâ€ Ewan dithers but decides against telling her about you. Not just yet. â€œJust visiting a friend. Iâ€™ll stay here for a while then fly out to New York donâ€™t worry.â€  â€œOkay just keep in touch alright? Iâ€™ll send more details about the meeting soon.â€  â€œSure thing. Thank you Donna.â€   â€œTalk soon Ewan. Take care of yourself.â€  Donna feels a huge sense of relief wash over her when the call ends knowing the whereabouts of one of her biggest clients. But why LA? Perhaps Ewan just needed some time off after the flurry of annoying headlines put out in the UK.  Or maybe heâ€™s visiting with a friend? Who is stateside right now? Fabienâ€™s filming in Philly. The rest of the boys are still in England. But thenâ€¦  Her thoughts land on the one thing - the one person - that would make him fly out on such short notice. Without giving thought to anything else especially after the speculation on his romantic life.  Ewanâ€™s never been one to share about personal affairs not even to his close-knit team but no matter how reclusive he is no one can deny the way he looks at you. The way he lights up when youâ€™re brought up in conversation. The number of times he had excused himself from their meetings to make a call standing in the corner with a permanent smile etched on his face.   Oh Donna knows now just who he is in LA for.   â–ªï¸ â–ªï¸ â–ªï¸ â–ªï¸ â–ªï¸ â–ªï¸ â–ªï¸  Like inevitable spectres haunting someone of his profession Ewan noticed the papparazzi snapping away as he arrived in LA.   He told no one he would be coming so it must be an automatic thing in the city. The photogs are always scurrying in the periphery ready to catch anyone of note no matter the degree of fame or notoriety.  If you were keeping up with such news you would know he is in the city.   But according to your assistant Clara who was kind enough to inform him of your schedule you are still finishing up on another day of rehearsals for your upcoming rom-com. Ewan checked in the same hotel as you planning to seek you out as soon as you arrive back from work.  He hasnâ€™t spoken to you since the voicemail and since those false news broke out. Not that he can blame you - wouldnâ€™t anyone be suspicious of a drunken confession made by a guy who was allegedly in the company of another girl?  He hates it being subject to all of this. This nonsense that is keeping you from him not even worth any consequence.  But he will deal with the blows. As long as he sets things right with you. As long he gets you in the end.   He settles in his suite getting ready to meet with you once more. He showers shaves tousles his hair. He even checks whether he smells decent after all of that - once twice and another time. Being nervous to stand in front of a crowd is one thing; itâ€™s a whole other conundrum for him finally see you again.   Maybe the crowds are more manageable and it baffles him to realise so. He can put on a persona be the actor and disappear inside himself as the cameras flash bright enough for him to disassociate.  But not with you. He wants to show you everything that he is who he truly is and it scares him. There is no team to help him get ready now. Itâ€™s all him just Ewan.   Clad in his trusty black jeans and a comfortable hoodie of the same dark colour he looks in the mirror one last time after receiving a text from Clara that youâ€™ve arrived at the hotel about half an hour ago.  He contemplates opening the bottle of bourbon from the minibar and taking a shot of liquid courage - something to help him get his explanation ready. Just so he wouldnâ€™t stammer in front of you.   Just so you he can make you see without any error or trace of doubt that he meant every word in that voicemail no matter how embarrassing it might have sounded.  He decides against it imagining the wrinkling of your nose as you catch a whiff of the alcohol. Itâ€™s cute when you do it and he adores it so dearly but he knows that it isnâ€™t the right moment.  He rights himself rolls his shoulders and heâ€™s out the door.   â–ªï¸ â–ªï¸ â–ªï¸ â–ªï¸ â–ªï¸ â–ªï¸ â–ªï¸  Jacob trails you inside your hotel suite laughing at some shared remark about the scenes you rehearsed for the day.  They were emotionally demanding and even after tossing around ideas for hours the two of you were unable to achieve a satisfying approach to the scenes.  Which is why he had proposed practicing well into the evening and you found yourselves heading back to your suite together. He has his own house in LA but your hotel just happened to be closer to the rehearsal studio.   â€œCare for a drink?â€ you asked him.  â€œWhy the hell not?â€ he immediately assents in that easy Aussie drawl. â€œWe might need it for this shite.â€  You laugh in agreement â€œIndeed. Iâ€™ve got some canned gin and tonics if thatâ€™s alright.. or beerâ€¦ or whiskeyâ€¦ â€ you trail off as you study the contents of your fridge.  â€œG and t please mateâ€ he settles down on the couch legs stretching in front of him. â€œWe were so unproductive today. I just could not get that line right.â€  â€œTell me about it.â€ You hand him his drink and he clinks it with yours with a mumbled cheers. â€œIt was me who canâ€™t land the right toneâ€ you say. â€œI mean is my character supposed to be confused in that moment? Or angry? Or sad?â€  â€œOr all of â€˜em.â€ he shrugs. â€œTricky isnâ€™t it?â€  You hurriedly fetch your script from a table getting right down to it. â€œSo for the first scene in the third actâ€¦â€   Moments later with cans of gin and tonic discarded on the coffee table you and Jacob sit with legs crossed on the couch facing each other. Scripts in hand you go through the lines over and over with only seemingly minor tweaks each time. To an actor though even just the slightest change of pitch or expression makes all the difference.  â€œIs that better? I think we almost got itâ€ you say after a read-through.   â€œYeah so much betterâ€ he grins holding his hand up for a high-five. Just as your hands smack in the air another sound echoes faintly from the door.   â€œSomeoneâ€™s knocking?â€ Jacob asks. â€œYou expecting anybody? Room service or anything?â€  â€œNoâ€ you shake your head trying to think of whether your assistant or publicist said anything about dropping by. â€œMaybe itâ€™s just housekeeping?â€  â€œIâ€™ll get itâ€ Jacob states already padding his way to the door.  A beat later you hear Jacob loudly exclaim â€œEwan mate! Itâ€™s good to see you!â€  Ewan? A shiver runs up your spine. Craning your neck to get a view of a doorway you catch sight of him half-obscured by Jacobâ€™s tall frame.   Confused surprised and feeling some other emotion you canâ€™t pinpoint you head over to greet him.   â€œHow are you doing?â€ Jacob greets shaking Ewanâ€™s hand oblivious to the poorly hidden distaste in his eyes.   â€œWh-what are you doing here?â€ Ewan finds himself asking Jacob a bit rudely just as you ask him the same.   â€œWhat are you doing here?â€ you mirror his question at the exact same time.  â€œOh!â€ Jacob breathes out a laugh â€œWell Iâ€™ll go first. We were just practicing lines.â€  â€œIn her room? Isnâ€™t it a bit late for rehearsal? I thought youâ€™re supposed to be off work.â€ Ewan asks and it sounds like an accusation. He starts to feel all kinds of uneasy - were the twins right about life imitating art?   You narrow your eyes at him. â€œWe decided to continue running lines after rehearsal. Thereâ€™s a scene we canâ€™t get right. Itâ€™s quite tricky - â€  â€œJust the two of you? Alone here?â€ Ewan tilts his head gesturing towards the room like itâ€™s some forbidden place.  Jacob shakes his head smile steady on his lips. If heâ€™s caught on to how Ewan must be feeling he doesnâ€™t let it affect him. He gives you a look as if to check your reaction and you give him a reassuring shrug.  Ewan does not overlook this exchange. He clenches his jaw irate from the assumptions popping up in his mind. Before he forgets his manners he says â€œExcuse me I justâ€¦ wasnâ€™t expectingâ€¦ I just wanted to speak to you.â€  â€œI didnâ€™t even know you were in LAâ€ you say before moving aside to usher him in. â€œBut Iâ€™m glad you are of course. Come join us - â€  He nods making his way to the seating area where he spies the discarded cans of alcohol and dog-eared scripts. Maybe he should have taken that bloody shot after all.   He laughs joylessly to himself shaking his head. â€œSorry you guys. I just flew in today and I must have been exhausted from the flight.â€  â€œHey no worries mateâ€ Jacob says. â€œYou know what Iâ€™ll be on my way. Give you time to catch up and all.â€ He picks up his own tattered script then gives you a kiss on the cheek bidding you with a â€œIâ€™ll see you tomorrow. Have a good night sweetheart.â€   If looks could kill and if his dear mother hadnâ€™t raised him right he would have incinerated Jacob in that moment.   He is snapped out of his thoughts when Jacob claps him on the shoulder â€œGreat to see you again mate. Have a good night eh?â€  Ewan knows heâ€™s being ridiculous. Thereâ€™s nothing wrong with two friends and co-stars spending some time alone to rehearse. Besides last he heard you were adamant that you and Jacob are just friends.   So why is he being so irrational? Why does the idea of you spending more time than necessary with Jacob possibly falling for him bother him so much?   Ewan realises that this is what jealousy must feel like.   Heâ€™s had career envy before. Another actor landing a role he vied for. Someone else getting the praise he deserves.   But nothing like this. Itâ€™s petty and possessive.   He wants you to just be his.   You stand in front of him once more after you walk Jacob out of the suite.   â€œHeyâ€ you say smiling weakly.   â€œHi darling.â€  Both of you want to do more. Say more. Usually you would greet each other with a hug and a kiss on a cheek his hands lingering on your forearms even after you pull away but the air is thick with tension.  You look at him with those bright expecting eyes of yours and Ewan just wants to cave in and make a sloppy confession. But not after that voicemail no. Heâ€™s determined to do this right. Words not slurred head clear.   â€œSo I got your voicemailâ€ you finally say smiling coyly. â€œThat wasâ€¦ something.â€  â€œHmmâ€ he canâ€™t help but mirror your smile as always. â€œIt was wasnâ€™t it?â€  â€œI understandâ€ you continue taking a step closer â€œif you were drunk. We all say things when weâ€™re off it that we maybe donâ€™t mean - â€  â€œBut darling I meant every wordâ€ he says way too quickly.   You laugh the sound of it erasing whatever apprehension remained in him. â€œDo you even remember what you said?â€  â€œI doâ€ he counters moving even closer to you. Another step and heâ€™d be able to wrap his arms around your waist and pull you to him. â€œAt least some of - no - most of it.â€  â€œOh yeah?â€ you ask cheekily aided by the effect of gin. He still has your heart racing but a part of you now knows that the feeling is mutual. â€œWhat did you say again?â€   He sees that glint in your eye and it causes him to smirk. â€œWhy donâ€™t I make it simple for you darling?â€ He closes the distance one hand brushing the hair from your face.   â€œOkayâ€ you swallow getting lost in his blues.   â€œI missed you.â€ He kisses your cheek. â€œI like you. A lot.â€ He kisses the other. â€œAnd I uh I would like to take you on a date.â€  His eyes meet yours. His voice is steady but you notice some nervousness in his gaze. How the tables have turned. You make Ewan Mitchellâ€™s heart go awry.   â€œPlease darling?â€ he timidly adds the sentiment so sweet you want to blurt out yes immediately. Before you can heâ€™s already leaned back an explanation rushing out of his lips â€œAndâ€¦ Iâ€™m not sure but you must have seen those headlines? Theyâ€™re not true I swear. We were out drinking and - â€  â€œI know Ewan.â€ You cut him off with a hand pressed gently on his chest but he keeps going.   â€œ - some other people joined us. One of them being - â€  â€œLuke and Elliottâ€™s cousin. I know. Elliott called and told me everything.â€  â€œOh. He called you?â€ A huge sense of relief washes over him better than any comfort he might have found in a shot or three of bourbon.   â€œMhmm he called me yesterday. So you know you didnâ€™t really have to fly out. I was about to call you eventually.â€  He smiles bashfully eyes cast down as a blush spreads across his cheeks. Damn it Elliott you brilliant lad. He reminds himself to treat Elliott to a pint the next time he sees him.   â€œI still wanted to see youâ€ Ewan maintains pressing a kiss to your forehead and youâ€™re immediately enveloped by the familiar comfort of his scent. Surprisingly without the staple hint of cigarette smoke due to his frantic scrubbing after the flight.   â€œIâ€™m happy youâ€™re hereâ€ you say wrapping your arms around his waist cheek pressed against his chest. â€œAnd no offence to Louise or anything but she needs to learn some boundaries with my - â€  Ewan looks down at you fondly squeezing your arms to prompt your next words â€œYeah darling? Your what?â€  â€œMy - â€ you attempt to bury your face in his hoodie but he keeps your gaze with a hand cupping your jaw. So you end up saving yourself with â€œ - my Aemond.â€  â€œHmmâ€ he hums lips curling and itâ€™s so very Aemond of him it makes you feel warm all over. â€œYour Aemond.Your Ewan. Iâ€™m all yours love.â€  The whole thing couldnâ€™t have gone any better all things considered and Ewan feels content to have gotten over his first brush with the rumour mill. What matters is right in front of him and you know the truth.   â€œAre you staying in this hotel? How did you even know I was here?â€ You take his hand guiding him over to the couch.  â€œClaraâ€ is all Ewan says by way of explanation.  â€œWell thank you Claraâ€ you declare. Ewan shuffles closer to you and rests his arm around your shoulders planting a kiss on your forehead again. The gesture is already becoming instinctive providing the both of you with a sense of ease.  â€œDarling?â€  â€œYeah?â€ you respond absentmindedly fingers toying with the soft fabric of his hoodie.   â€œIs that a yes?â€  You exhale deeply. As if it wasnâ€™t clear enough already. â€œWhat do you think handsome?â€  â€œI donâ€™t know angel. You tell meâ€ he counters cheekily his fingers playing with your hair as you playfully glare at him.  â€œWhat if I say no baby?â€  â€œThen Iâ€™ll have to work hard to change your mind princess.â€  â€œAnd how would you do that honey?â€  His gaze darkens and something flashes across his blue eyes as he whispers intensely â€œUse your imagination bunny.â€   â€œRi-rightâ€ you bite your lip then shake your head to snap out of it. â€œWeâ€™ll have to draw the line at bunny.â€  He laughs at your flustered state pleased by the effect he has on you. â€œWhatâ€™s wrong with bunny?â€  That elicits a groan out of you but you smile anyway. â€œI already said yes Ewan. Quit it with the bunny.â€  â€œAlright beautifulâ€ he relents making you lean even closer against him.   The haze of gin after a long work day starts to subside and the rush of emotion is coming back to you. You find yourself gazing at Ewan in mild disbelief in awe that he just confessed that he wants you.   Feeling antsy you stand and pace around the room. You start tidying things putting your scattered knick-knacks back in your handbag. If you sit with him any longer you just might end up hurrying things through and jump his bones already kiss him the next time he does that hmm.   â€œCan I get you anything?â€ you ask.   â€œNoâ€ he says smoothly. â€œI just need you.â€ The words make you stop in your tracks. He still sits in the same position looking at you with that undeniable desire in his eyes.  â€œUhhhmâ€ your mouth feels dry all of the sudden. Nothing his tongue past your lips canâ€™t fix your intrusive thoughts barge right in. â€œSoâ€¦ theâ€¦ the media rolloutâ€™s still going on isnâ€™t it? Should we check and see?â€ You take your laptop and plop back down next to him. He doesnâ€™t miss a beat and cuddles against you once more wrapping his arm around your tense frame.   â€œI think so darling.â€ The media rollout is how the interviews and promotional material filmed by the cast is being released gradually on a weekly basis after each new episode comes out.   A simple search on Youtube confirms it and the first thing that popped up is the Where is The Lie? video you did for Elle.   It was slated for just Tom Phia and Ewan but your Blackwood character became such a fan-favourite that they asked you to join in. Not to mention the frenzy you and Ewan caused online with the initial interviews you did together.   â€œShall we watch this?â€ Ewan offers solely for the intent of seeing you in the video.  You click on it and for the next 8 minutes or so all you can take note of are the signs that had clearly already been there. The fans were on to something when they claimed that you and Ewan are a really good ship.   The video starts with a clip of Phia hitting her head on the overhead lamp when she stands prompting her to uncontrollably giggle along with you and Tom. Ewan being the exception is beside himself with worry and he appears to instinctively reach for your hand as you sit beside him.   â€œHuhâ€ Ewan smiles taking your hand and pressing a kiss to the back of it.   Tom is the first to be put on the hot seat and he slowly recites the three statements he prepared. â€œEwan pay attentionâ€ Tom blurts out when he notices that Ewan kept sneaking glances at you. â€œSure Iâ€™m locked inâ€ Ewan says right back as you and Phia share a look.   â€œWhat were you looking at?â€ you ask playfully poking him in the side. â€œYou seem plenty distracted there.â€  He snorts at himself in the video when he ends up smiling as he caught your eye. â€œIt was your fault. You were distracting me.â€  â€œI was not!â€ you exclaim. â€œI thought you were just being competitive then.â€  Phia is next to have a go. She tells you of a Wifi repellent necklace a wrestling career and saving a squirrel from a drainpipe. â€œThe Wifi thing sounds like something Ewan would haveâ€ Tom jokes. â€œOh sureâ€ you concur â€œexcept that heâ€™d actually keep it so he can watch films.â€ Ewan smiles at your acute observation.   â€œIâ€™d also keep it to stalk your Instagramâ€ Ewan mumbles from beside you. â€œAnd you know just stalk you in general.â€  â€œIâ€™m sure you do Mitchellâ€ you respond casually but your face warms up anyhow.   Itâ€™s Ewanâ€™s turn and as he sits on the hot seat you see Tom and Phia casting a look at each other then at the two of you a secret message shared between them. â€œI bet she will know the answer right awayâ€ Phia says. â€œYeah how do we know the two of you didnâ€™t conspire together?â€ Tom asks. â€œAre you kidding me you guys?â€ you laugh at them thinking how silly they were being not knowing then that they were definitely on to something.   â€œDarling you have to know thisâ€ Ewan tells you specifically as you all try to guess the answer. â€œOh darling!â€ Tom mouths to Phia dramatically flipping nonexistent long hair over his shoulder. Phia laughs at his antics before nudging you and saying â€œWhich one is it? Which is the lie? I trust you.â€ You respond â€œWhy me? You two should know this too!â€  â€œBecause I wasnâ€™t trying to date them my loveâ€ Ewan says smiling at the screen.   â€œOh come on now.â€ You crane your neck up to press a soft kiss against his cheek before turning your attention back to the video. So you donâ€™t notice the switch in Ewanâ€™s breathing. The jumps in his heartbeart. The way he subtly clears his throat to deal with his flustered state.  The video comes to a close after your turn and even at the very end Ewan can be seen admiring you as you give the closing remarks with Phia.  Admiring you as he does in the moment.   â€œYouâ€™re beautiful you know that?â€ he says when you turn to look at him.   â€œThank youâ€ you reply softly your voice barely audible.   Some time passes with the two of you catching up talking about your upcoming projects his big meeting in New York - all the while his fingers trace patterns on your exposed skin his arm wrapped around you snugly.   â€œHave you been keeping up with the show?â€ he asks.  â€œThe last episode I saw fully wasâ€¦ the second one? I got pretty busy after that. How about you?â€  â€œOhâ€ he looks down in thought piquing your curiosity â€œso you didnâ€™t get to see the third episode yet then?â€  â€œNo not yetâ€ you shake your head â€œbut Iâ€™ve seen some stuff here and there.â€  He hums again and he wants to ask have you seen his stuff? There are around a dozen or so potential jokes at play here. He has an inkling to tell you to watch the episode so you can see just what youâ€™re in for. So you can see him and all he has to offer. Heâ€™d also fumble through a justification as he had done in some interview about the new studio they had filmed in being cold as a fridge freezer.  What to say? What to say? He picks at some lint on his jeans smirking to himself.   â€œYeahâ€ you eventually giggle at his obvious hesitation. â€œIâ€™ve only seen some of the episode. But what Iâ€™ve seenâ€¦ is enough to make me jealous of Madame Sylvie.â€  He stiffens throat suddenly dry but one look at your smile does away with his concerns.   He soon finds himself laughing a muffled â€œOh darlingâ€ whispered lovingly against your hair.  â€œThat was very brave of you Ewanâ€ you express sincerely.   â€œThank you love.â€  â€œSoâ€¦ just how cold was it in there?â€  Your shared unrestrained laughter echo throughout the room.   â–ªï¸ â–ªï¸ â–ªï¸ â–ªï¸ â–ªï¸ â–ªï¸ â–ªï¸  Your first date was meant to happen the following night but such is the nature of the job that Ewanâ€™s schedule gets moved up all of a sudden.  Once the bigshot casting director in New York found out that Ewan is already stateside he requested that the meeting be held at the earliest possible opportunity.  He calls you while you are in rehearsals profusely apologizing and promising to fly back to LA in the next two days right after his meeting is all sorted.  â€œItâ€™s okay Ewanâ€ you reassure him genuinely understanding. â€œI will see you when you come back. Good luck I know youâ€™re going to smash it whatever opportunity this is!â€  â€œThank you darlingâ€ he says already wanting to have you back in his arms already mentally kicking himself for not kissing you when he had about a hundred chances to do so. â€œIâ€™m going to miss you.â€  â€œIâ€™ll miss you tooâ€ you respond blushing silly with the phone pressed to your ear. â€œBut itâ€™ll only be two days.â€  â€œHmm doesnâ€™t matter. I need to take you on our bloody date darling. Iâ€™ve already taken so damn long.â€  â€œDonâ€™t worryâ€ you say â€œIâ€™ve already seen you way more than I should before the first date.â€  â€œWha - â€ a protest forms on his lips but he gets your point right away. â€œOh. Clever darling.â€  â€œI know.â€  â€œBut Iâ€™m planning to give you something thatâ€™s just for you. That the whole world wonâ€™t ever be privy to.â€  You swallow hard your very being heating up at his insinuation. â€œDonâ€™t make promises you canâ€™t keep Mitchell.â€  â€œI guess youâ€™ll just have to wait and see.â€  Bonus chapter! post_body: We are four episodes into this season and iâ€™m still bitter they skipped Jaceâ€™s tour of diplomacy around Westeros and Cregan Jace and the pact of ice and fire in particular.  Itâ€™s a major character beat for Jace and another way to show how competent and smart he is itâ€™s also a way to see other members of Team Black like Jeyne Arryn and to explicitly point out the misogyny by giving her that quote.  Also Cregan and Jace feels like an incredibly important part of history especially considering the name of the pact both because of politics and magic considering this is the first attempts to marry house Stark and Targaryen/ice and fire.  It was also a way to rectify an error of Game of Thrones by actually having the Manderlys being the Manderlys.  Especially because Jace is kinda just standing around looking angry and baffled by the choices his mother make.   Was the conversation with Baela needed ? Yes   Was the hug between Jace and Rhaenyra extremely good ? Also yes but there was a way all of those could fit.   They could have done this scene after the tour. Jace in the first episode goes to see Jeyne and the Manderlys (it would be 2 scenes instead of the hug and that Cregan/Jace scene at the wall ) episode 2 is Cregan and theirs friendship (and thatâ€™s when he learn about Lukeâ€™s death because Rhaenyra is in denial in the first episode) he comes back to Dragonstone in episode 3 have the hug and the conversation with Baela while the other drama of team Black is between Rhaena and Rhaenyra which you could have done if you didnâ€™t have the nonsensical scene at the Sept.  Nothing else had to change in the show.  But that would be giving more screentime to the Blacks and we canâ€™t have that.

post_body: So ok let me rant.  I donâ€™t think I can keep watching HOTD. I love the story in itself yes but it is just too painful. First the dragon scenes are excruciating and second I am not loving what they are doing to the story. Rhaenyra is just a goody two shoes I love her I get her not wanting to plunge the realm into chaos thatâ€™s all fine and admirable but she has been boring. Itâ€™s not Emmaâ€™s fault at all but I would love to see Millyâ€™s Rhaenyra with her fierce personality that was so captivating. Younger Rhaenyra was not mean I donâ€™t believe she would have wanted war for the sake of it but she was so compelling that I would still love her plot. And Daemon I cannot. They are destroying Daemon to me. He is my most beloved character more than in the book. I know heâ€™s not good and I donâ€™t want him to be but still I was in love with their romance in season up to ep10 as I donâ€™t remember being in love with a tv show romance in a decade as gothic and twisted as it was. And episode 10 destroyed it for me I canâ€™t stand abusive relationships and that chocking scene was so OOC that I felt betrayed. What had I been watching for the other 9 episodes was it all a lie? Because I am sure I saw a man very deeply in love with a woman a man that became a shadow of himself without her in his life. And all because he had done the right thing. Leaving her in the brothel was not abandoning her it was the right thing to do thatâ€™s where I fell in love with their romance honestly. He was overwhelmed by what he was feeling but she was still so young so he spared her from himself from his darkness. Still he went to her wedding to make sure that she was happy with her marriage and you can just see his face when he sees her so radiant dancing with Laenor that he wants her to be happy. So he gives her up. Yet he wanted to hear from her lips that this marriage was what she wanted and so he goes to her and she confirms that she wants it then she challenges him taunts him and he almost loses his mind which was just another reason to let her live her life without him. I was so proud of him. But after episode 10 I read producers saying that Daemon should not be loved by the public because he was evil and the chocking scene was him being what he always was. Bullshit! I realized they were going to do him dirty in season 2 so I almost did not watch it. And I only did because Matt Smith and the producers were saying that Daemon loves Rhaenyra deeply and they are connected kindred spirits and that Daemon would do anything for her and thatâ€™s what I wanted to hear for the past 2 years so I relented. His crying when he saw young Rhaenyra with Jaehaerys gave me hope. But then him beheading the version of her he loved the most/ loved him the most? Because he was jealous of his brother? And now him sleeping with Aemma or Alyssa? Like it doesnâ€™t matter who the woman is as long as she is a Targaryen queen? His â€œcuriosityâ€ for Alys? Challenging Rhaenyraâ€™s claim to become king and then she is â€œwelcomed to join him as his (submissive) queenâ€? What is this? I want to believe Mattâ€™s words I love the Daemon that he describes but thatâ€™s not what I am watching right now.

post_body: TOM GLYNN-CARNEY INTERVIEWED FOR VESTAL MAGAZINE.   REFLECTING ON YOUR JOURNEY IN THE ACTING INDUSTRY DO YOU REMEMBER THE MOMENT YOU REALIZED YOU REALIZED YOU WANTED TO PURSUE ACTING?  â€œThe moment I realized I wanted to pursue acting was probably when I was around 12 years old in high school.â€ â€œI was performing in a production of Shakespeareâ€™s Macbeth at the Royal Exchange in Manchester.â€ â€œI saw older actors and wondered what their "properâ€ jobs were outside of the theater.â€œ â€˜When I asked one of them they saidâ€™: â€” "No this is my proper job. This is what I do.â€ â€œI didnâ€™t know people could do that.â€ â€œFrom that moment on I knew that this is what I wanted to do as a career.â€ YOUâ€™VE DONE MULTIPLE SHOWS AND MOVIES IN THE DRAMATIC GENRE. WOULD YOU EVER BE OPEN TO DOING OTHER GENRES?  â€œAbsolutely Iâ€™d love to explore new genres in the future.â€ â€œIâ€™d love to give comedy a go.â€ â€œI think that would be a good challenge.â€ â€œItâ€™s difficult because timing is crucial delivering a joke at the right time can feel almost mathematical.â€ â€œBut I think that good comedy actors donâ€™t see it that way at all.â€ â€œIt just comes naturally to them.â€ â€œIâ€™d love to give it a shot.â€ â€œIâ€™m also interested in doing biopics bringing real-life stories to life.â€ â€œChet Baker and Gene Kelly in particular would be fascinating characters to portray.â€ â€œBut Iâ€™m open to any interesting projects that come my way.â€ HOW DO YOU CHOOSE THE ROLES YOU TAKE ON? ARE YOU DRAWN TO A PARTICULAR TYPE OF CHARACTER OR STORY?  â€œHonestly Iâ€™m drawn to anything that makes me feel uncomfortable and pushes me out of my comfort zone.â€ â€œI seek out roles where the character feels distant and challenging.â€ â€œI like to test myself and see if I can bring such characters to life.â€ â€œIf a role feels like something I might struggle with thatâ€™s exactly what I want to tackle.â€ â€œI often joke that these challenging roles might be my downfall someday.â€ laughs CAN YOU SHARE ANY INSIGHTS INTO HOW YOUR CHARACTER AEGON II TARGARYEN ENVOLVES IN THE UPCOMING SEASON?  â€œI found it fascinating to delve deeper into Aegon this season because thereâ€™s so much more to uncover about him.â€ â€œIn the first season we saw quite a two-dimensional view of Aegonâ€”not due to Ty Tennantâ€™s portrayal which I thought was fantastic bringing a lot of vulnerability and teenage angst to the character.â€ â€œWhen I took over the time frame was too short to really explore Aegonâ€™s complexities.â€ â€œThis time Iâ€™ve had an extended period to sit with the character and dig into his deeper layers.â€ â€œPlaying a character experiencing profound grief is always a challenge.â€ â€œIâ€™m lucky enough that Iâ€™ve never gone through anything like that myself so I had to imagine it as vividly as possible.â€ â€œThis season Aegon is shown as more of an empath than a psychopath.â€ â€œIt becomes clear that he has the capacity to love feel and grieve.â€ â€œThere are so many comparisons between Aegon and Richard II.â€ â€œPeople are saying Aegon is cold calculated and evil and while heâ€™s certainly done horrible thingsâ€”Iâ€™m not justifying any of thoseâ€”itâ€™s important to note that rather than being a straightforward villain heâ€™s a crumbling tragedy.â€ HOW HAS YOUR APPROACH TO PORTRAYING AEGON II CHANGED FROM THE PREVIOUS SEASON TO THE NEW ONE?  â€œThereâ€™s definitely a continuation of the drama and theatricality from season one.â€ â€œItâ€™s huge rousing and intense.â€ â€œIâ€™ve seen episodes one to four and they are just unbelievable especially the battle scenes â€” you canâ€™t get any bigger than that.â€ â€œThis season though thereâ€™s also an element of humor.â€ â€œAt some point they called Aegon 'the Magnanimousâ€™ and it was important to bring some levity to his character.â€ â€œAegon has just stepped into the role of King and is trying to figure it all out.â€ â€œWeâ€™re at a point where heâ€™s found a spring in his step enjoying this new responsibility and purpose.â€ â€œHeâ€™s also got a lot of power now.â€ â€œPower can go to peopleâ€™s heads and make them crazy.â€ â€œIt was nice to explore his boyishness and playfulness as it gives his character more depth and leaves room for growth.â€ WHAT WOULD YOU TELL PEOPLE TO GET THEM ON TEAM GREEN?  â€œI donâ€™t think I need to persuade themâ€”obviously weâ€™re the best.â€ â€œBut if you really want to see why this season is packed with surprises that will make it clear.â€ SINCE THE SHOW IS BASED ORIGINALLY ON BOOKS IS THERE A SPECIFIC BOOK YOUâ€™D LIKE TO SEE BROUGHT TO THE SCREEN AND FOR YOU TO BE A PART OF?  â€œIâ€™d love to see a film adaptation of Douglas Stuartâ€™s book Shuggie Bain.â€ â€œAnother great choice would be The Thousand Autumns of Jacob de Zoet by David Mitchell.â€ â€œItâ€™s a collection of beautiful and heart-wrenching short stories and each one could make a compelling film.â€ â€œLooking at my bookshelf now I see a lot of books on Bob Dylan David Bowie and Paul McCartneyâ€”mostly singer-songwriters.â€ â€œI also have a lot of poetry. Iâ€™d love to see a biopic of Patti Smith.â€ â€œThat would be incredible.â€ YOUR CAREER HAS TAKEN YOU TO VARIOUS FILMING LOCATIONS AROUND THE WORLD. IS THERE A SPECIFIC LOCATION YOU HAVENâ€™T BEEN TO YET AND WOULD LOVE TO BE THE BACKDROP FOR A POTENTIAL FUTURE PROYECT?  â€œOh thatâ€™s a good question.â€ â€œI think somewhere thatâ€™s a hybrid between beautiful rolling countryside and the coast.â€ â€œA place that offers both stunning landscapes and the sea.â€ â€œOn your days off you could go for a swim or hike through the mountains.â€ â€œIâ€™d love to work in a scenic and peaceful location like that.â€ SOMETIMES ACTORS WHO PLAY 'VILLAINSâ€™ CAN GET AN ADVERSE REACTION FROM SOME FANS OF A SHOW. WHAT HAVE YOUR INTERACTIONS BEEN LIKE?  â€œIâ€™ve been very lucky.â€ â€œMany people have approached me with kind words about my portrayal of Aegon.â€ â€œItâ€™s a challenging task to humanize someone so seemingly poisonous.â€ â€œFortunately I havenâ€™t had negative encounters with fans who canâ€™t differentiate between the character and the actor.â€ â€œI think weâ€™re in a different phase in society now.â€ â€œWhen Jack Gleeson played Joffrey there was less social media presence making it harder for audiences to separate the actor from the character.â€ â€œToday I think we are a more technologically advanced community with more behind-the-scenes and a better understanding of the distinction between actor and character.â€ â€œI think people have copped on. I hope thatâ€™s the case anyway.â€ YOUâ€™VE COLLABORATED WITH RENOWNED DIRECTORS LIKE CHRISTOPHER NOLAN. WHAT HAVE YOU LEARNED FROM THESE EXPERIENCES?  â€œDoing Dunkirk was my first significant experience on a film set.â€ â€œI really didnâ€™t know where to start.â€ â€œThe canvas was completely blank.â€ â€œAnd it was just such a gift a pinch me moment that I was able to learn from some of if not the best filmmaker in the world.â€ â€œIt was overwhelming.â€ â€œAnd I had to remind myself to be present and soak in everything like a sponge.â€ â€œChrisâ€™s patience and the support from the rest of the cast were invaluable throughout.â€ â€œWe were all in it together especially us young lads who were new to such a big production.â€ â€œWe learned and grew together during that incredible experience.â€ IN THE KING YOU PORTRAYED A HISTORICAL FIGURE. HOW DID YOU APPROACH BRINGING THIS CHARACTER TO LIFE?  â€œWhen portraying a fictional character thereâ€™s often more freedom because thereâ€™s no definitive blueprint to followâ€”even if theyâ€™re written in a book theyâ€™re still fictional.â€ â€œYou can infuse your own understanding and personality into the role.â€ â€œHowever thereâ€™s added pressure when it comes to a historical figure because youâ€™re portraying someone real.â€ â€œI never let that pressure overwhelm or hinder the process.â€ â€œInstead I took the character as presented and focused on doing my best with the role.â€ A NEW HUNGER GAMES MOVIE WAS JUST ANNOUNCED SPECIFICALLY A PREQUEL FOCUSING ON HAYMITCHâ€™S STORY AND MANY FANS ARE EAGER TO SEE YOU IN THAT ROLE. WHAT ARE YOUR THOUGHTS ON THAT?  â€œNo way thatâ€™s the first Iâ€™ve heard of it! But Iâ€™m incredibly flattered that people would like to see me on screen again.â€ â€œIf all goes well Iâ€™ll fight for my life in the Hunger Games!â€ laugh WHAT ARE SOME OF YOUR FAVORITE SHOWS DURING YOUR DOWNTIME?  â€œOne show I watch repeatedly and it never gets old for me is the UK version of The Office.â€ â€œThe humor is very relatable and comforting to me.â€ â€œI even laugh just thinking about it. Itâ€™s one of those TV shows when it finishes youâ€™re like: â€” â€œOh no! What do I do with my life? I miss the characters already.â€ laugh "I also enjoy the US version of The Office.â€ â€œBesides that Iâ€™m fascinated by farming documentaries.â€ â€œShows like This Farming Life on BBC are incredibly calming for me.â€ â€œAnd I have to mention The Great Pottery Throwdown â€” Iâ€™m a bit of a pottery nerd and that show is brilliant! WHO ARE SOME CREATIVES YOU WOULD LOVE TO WORK WITH IN THE FUTURE?  "The list is long.â€ â€œFirstly there are directors Iâ€™d love to collaborate with again like Chris Nolan and Sam Mendes with whom Iâ€™ve had some of my best experiences and whom I consider friends.â€ â€œIâ€™m eager to work with them again.â€ â€œThen there are filmmakers like Andrea Arnold Yorgos Lanthimos Greta Gerwig Paul Thomas Anderson and Ruben Ostlund all of whom I admire and would love to collaborate with.â€ â€œWhen it comes to actors there are many I admire as well.â€ â€œI plan to work with individuals who challenge me from whom I can learn and who are dedicated to their craft.â€ â€œI appreciate those who find joy and humor in their work because life is short and itâ€™s important to enjoy what you do.â€ LASTLY WHERE DO YOU HOPE YOUR CAREER WILL HEAD INTO THE FUTURE?  â€œItâ€™s more of a feeling than a checklist of achievements that I aim for.â€ â€œI understand that feeling because I can almost sense it in advance.â€ â€œItâ€™s difficult to articulateâ€”itâ€™s a mix of happiness creative fulfillment diversity in roles consistent challenge and pushing boundaries.â€ â€œI aspire to transform and lose myself in characters.â€ â€œEqually important to me is collaborating with inspiring individuals whom I can learn from and grow with.â€ â€œI also value the freedom to select projects that resonate with me personally.â€

post_body: The reason I am so obsessed with Aegon Targaryen the second is a simple one: he is just like me   I also was never enough for my father   My mother also loathed me and barely concealed her hatred of me  This shit stays with you no matter how much time you spend in therapy and how much work you put in healing  I will never feel like I deserve to be loved     And seeing all this in a fictional character who is widely perceived as a villain (donâ€™t get me wrong he is a terrible person and I am not excusing his actions) hurts like hell

Because in the end thatâ€™s the relationship. â€¦ And Meleys her dragon is ultimately her only friend.   Part of the thing that was devastating â€¦ was seeing Meleys being torn to shreds and feeling that somehow sheâ€™d let her down or betrayed her in some way. Just the awfulness of seeing this brave beast creature other self being destroyed.â€

post_body: ğ•ğ¢ğ¨ğ¥ğğ§ğ­ ğğğ¥ğ¢ğ ğ¡ğ­ğ¬   Paring: Jacaerys Velaryon x Targ oc  Warnings: Violence dragons fighting blood swearing character death dragon death  1.17     A pit in your stomach forms as you feel bile slowly creep up the inside of your throat burning it and leaving a horrid taste behind. It was taking everything in you not to cry. While a frantic meeting was taking place in the small council chamber you couldnâ€™t pull your eyes off of Jacaerys. He looks so lost. He was sitting at the far end of the table himself holding on tightly to your daughterâ€™s toy.  He was afraid of losing her.  One of the Queenâ€™s kingsguards had come with the news that Sunfyre had broken free out of the dragonpit. The bond between dragon and rider was strong and Sunfyre would most definitely be reunited with his rider on Dragonstone by now. Without taring your eyes away from your broken-looking husband you blurt out â€œI have a suggestion.â€  All eyes turn to you including your motherâ€™s fearful ones. You swallow thickly and Daemon nods for you to continue. â€œGo on.â€  â€œIt doesnâ€™t matter how many knights you send to Dragonstone; Sunfyre will burn them all before they ever step foot on land. The only way to win this battle is to send the dragons to warâ€”â€œ  â€œNo.â€  â€œYour graceâ€”â€  â€œI said no.â€ Your motherâ€™s voice is sharp. â€œWhen dragons fly to war everything burns. I have already lost three children; I will not lose anymore.â€  You want to argue for her to hear you out but not wanting to disrespect your mother you bite your tongue. If this were a private conversation youâ€™d happily argue your point but not in front of a council full of men. You hold her gaze from across the table silently letting her know you werenâ€™t backing down.  The corner of her lips pulls into a smile. â€œClear the room.â€  When the council members start to leave you lower your head slightly and your sight fixates on the shadow of the Seven-Pointed Star which is the most prominent symbol of the faith the Hightowers replaced the Targaryen symbols with. Once the dust has settled youâ€™ll need to speak to someone about having it destroyed and replaced with a three-headed dragon. The seven-pointed star no longer resembled the faith; it was a mockery of how blinded King Viserys was that he allowed his castle to be turned into theirs.  Hearing someone clicking their fingers you look up again and see Daemon taking the jug of wine from the cupbearer before he leaves the room. Silently he pours a cup for your mother Baela and Rhaena but not himself you or Jacaerys. He notices you staring and chuckles. â€œI reckon we will need a clear head for whatever you have planned.â€  â€œAegon wants us to know heâ€™s at Dragonstone hoping one of us will attack. I say we do just that. Ifâ€”â€  Leaning back with a huff Daemon says â€œYou want to give the enemy what he wants? Thatâ€™s your great plan?â€  The tone of his voice irks you; he had no faith in the plan you had yet to fully explain. â€œYes set a trap of our own.â€  Your husband finally speaks and even with rage building inside him Jaceâ€™s eyes soften when he looks at you. â€œWe mustnâ€™t forget that Sunfyre is one of the dragons that killed Meleys.â€  â€œI havenâ€™t forgotten what they did to Meleys or our grandmotherâ€ you swallow hard. â€œWhich is why I canâ€™t do it alone. I will fly to Dragonstone and taunt Aegon into chasing me on Sunfyre while the second rider is high enough that he wonâ€™t see them coming. It will take two of us to end this and prevent further bloodshed.â€  The room falls silent and nobody speaks for a beat. Jacaerys clears his throat. â€œVermax is smaller and quicker than Viserion; I will go and lure Aegon out. Besides itâ€™s me he sent the raven to; Aegon might suspect a trap if a different dragon goes.â€  â€œI will join you in the sky princessâ€ Baela says. â€œOur three dragons may be smaller than Sunfyre but with three against one the odds are in our favor.â€  â€œBoth Syrax and Caraxes are bigger thanâ€”â€  â€œMother no! You cannot go.â€  â€œWhat would you have me do Lyarra? Hide in my castle while my children go into battle? Do not ask me to cower here while you risk your life.â€  â€œYour grace at least one dragon rider should remain in the keep. If you all go it might give any green supports that are hiding in the shadows a chance to attackâ€ Rhaena says before looking at Daemon. â€œYou should go as well father; Caraxes is the only dragon with real experience in battle. And the greens may have ships with ballistas among them as they did here in Kingâ€™s Landing.â€  He smiles proudly then nods. â€œWe should prepare ourselves for battle then. Itâ€™s important we fly while itâ€™s still daylight.â€  â€”  Jacaerys watches as one of your handmaidens makes sure your braids are tight enough that none of your hair falls into your face. Unlike your husband and stepfather neither you nor Baela had armour and with very little time to prepare it was a scramble to find the two breastplates which were much heavier than you anticipated. The weight pressing down on your shoulders was borderline painful.  In the reflection of your vanity you notice Jace bouncing his knee quickly and that his neck is becoming red. â€œAre you okay my prince?â€  He lets out a small sigh. â€œI need a moment alone to speak with the princess.â€  The sight of his glossy eyes made you want to hold him and promise everything would be okay but you couldnâ€™t. When the room is empty he comes over to you and cups the side of your face. â€œIf things donâ€™t go the way we want a sacrifice may need to be made. The thought of you flying beside me in battle terrifies me but the thought of our children growing up without you is unbearable. Iâ€™m only saying this because I need you to know how much I love you Lyarra.â€  â€œIâ€™ll never leave you Jace. Not on the ground and not in the sky.â€  His voice cracks: â€œItâ€™s my fault Luke died and I wonâ€™t allow you to die like him.â€  â€œDying wonâ€™t bring him backâ€ you say pushing at his chest slightly. â€œThe absence of you in my life would kill me. IksÄ se jorrÄelagon hen Ã±uha Äbrar.â€  Jacaerys pulls you into his embrace and mumbles how much he loves you multiple times. Looking up you press a gentle kiss to his lips. â€œI just need to do something first then Iâ€™ll meet you in the courtyard.â€  â€”  â€œRhaena.â€  â€œLyarraâ€ she says placing a purple dragon egg into the small black brazier. â€œIâ€™m just waiting on Baela.â€  â€œI know; I was just wondering if I may have a word in private.â€  She looks concerned at you and sits on one of her chairs motioning for you to join her. â€œWhat is it you want to discuss? I can only imagine how urgent it must be.â€  â€œI definitely donâ€™t have time management skillsâ€ you say lightheartedly. â€œIâ€™ve come to you because youâ€™re one of the most kindhearted people I know. If the worst happens and me and Jacaerys donâ€™t return can you make sure my children donâ€™t forget how much we love them and Aemma never forgets that Jace thought of her as his own. She needs to remember that.â€  â€œOf courseâ€ she says squeezing your hand. â€œBut I believe the gods will be merciful and all four of you will return.â€  â€œThereâ€™s one more thing I need to ask of you regarding Princess Jaehaera and Prince Maelor.â€  â€œOh?â€  â€œNever let them forget how truly special Helaena was. She was so innocent and kindhearted.â€  Just like Rhaena.  â€œI will make sure they remember.â€  â€”  Teary-eyed your mother hugs each of you goodbye in the dragonpit. It hurt to see the fear in her eyes. She had already lost so much for a throne and war she never asked for.  Your younger brother runs towards Jacaerys who is preparing to mount his dragon. â€œI want to fight with you; I can help you protect our mother.â€  You feel emotional watching Jace pick Joffrey up to hug him; he kisses the side of your younger boyâ€™s head and says â€œYou need to stay here and help keep mother safe on the ground along with protecting lAegon and Viserys and the remaining dragons.â€  Joffrey was so young and sweet yet all he wanted to do was protect his family. â€œOh godsâ€ your mother says wrapping her arm around you. â€œBe safe my girl.â€  â€œI will return soon my queen and when I do more justice will be served. I love you mother.â€  â€”  It seems the gods were meddling in the war between kin; no man or woman is as accursed as the kinslayer and the gods were doing everything to delay the inevitable. Even though it was still daytime the sun was hidden behind thick dark clouds and the heavy rain and hail that fell from them were obscuring your vision. You could hear the flapping of wings and dragon roars all around you but youâ€™d lost sight of everyone else.  Frightened by a strike of lightning being so close Viserion roars loudly â€œumbagon gÄ«da Viserion.â€  Suddenly you break through the clouds. The rain was still pelting against your skin but you could see clearly now. In the distance Caraxes was burning ships and Moondancer was flying over to join the blood Wyrm but Jace and Vermax were out of sight.  â€œDracarys Sunfyre!â€  Youâ€™re blinded by a blast of Sunfyreâ€™s golden flames and begin to spin in the air when the two dragons latch onto each other. Viserion manages to rake the dragonâ€™s side and wriggle out of its grip.  Hearing a dragon squealing in pain you look towards the ships again and see a pale green figure plummeting towards the sea.  â€œBaela!â€  Aegon takes advantage of your being distracted and blasts you and Viserion in flames again. Thick smoke catches in your throat. Over the sound of your dragon crying in pain and the wind whistling you hear Aegon chuckling to himself. He yells â€œOnce Iâ€™m done killing your pup Iâ€™m coming back for you!â€  When the smoke clears youâ€™re horrified to see Sunfyreâ€™s claws digging into Vermaxâ€™s stomach. Jace was ordering his dragon to attack but itâ€™s not until they begin twirling that you notice the tip of Vermaxâ€™s tail is gone and bleeding heavily. Viserion bites the golden dragonâ€™s stomach long enough for it to let go of Vermax. The three dragons snap and claw at each other.  Jace screams as loud as he can â€œJikagon syt se tÄ«kuni!â€  For a split second you locked eyes with Aegon; he was confused. Thankfully his high Valyrian skills were lacking so it gave you and Jacaerys the ability to surprise him with your next move. Both of you momentarily retreat both ordering your dragons in unison to attack in your other tongue. Vermaxâ€™s jaws close around Sunfyreâ€™s left wing and Viserion punctures Sunfyreâ€™s right wing with his claws.  â€œDracarys!â€  Youâ€™re blasted in flames for a third time except now that you are closer it hits you and Viserion harder. The smell of burning flesh reaches your nostrils before the burning sensation starts in your hand causing you to scream in agony. If this didnâ€™t end soon your precious Viserion would die and the both of you would go down dragging Sunfyre and Aegon with you.  â€œJacaerys go!â€  He shouts something back high Valyrian but you canâ€™t make it out. Out of the corner of your eye you see something moving quickly before it disappears. Seconds later another dragon crashes into Sunfyre forcing Vermax to let go. Viserion squeals again and starts to lean to the side. You pull your harness strap even tighter.  Syrax clutches Sunfyreâ€™s neck between her jaws and as the golden dragon takes its last breaths you see Aegon pulling the Valyrian steel dagger that once belonged to your grandsire from his belt his murderous gaze in the direction of your mother.  â€œDracarys!â€  Tears roll down your cheeks hearing Aegon scream. You never wanted this. If only he had fled to Sunfyre instead of  Syrax lets go and both the dragon and rider crash into the waves below.  Everything is a blur of fire and blood before Viserion crashes onto the shore below.  â€”  Viserion lets out a low grumble when you kneel on the damp sand and stick your arm into the water attempting to clean the burn on your right hand. He could sense your physical pain and emotional distress. Caraxes was the only other dragon you had seen since the dragons stopped fighting. He was headed in the direction of Kings- Landing but you had yet to see Vermax Syrax or Moondancer.  You press your free hand to your forehead and feel a liquid warmer than it should be. Blood. You must have hit your head when you fell unstrapping yourself. The bleeding would explain the pounding in your head. The dampness of your dress makes it feel much heavier so you sit back on your heels. Nightfall was coming quickly and the small folk who witnessed the fight would soon gather on the beaches to see what remained.  Viserion suddenly snarls.  The pale pink flesh of Sunfyreâ€™s wing stuck between your dragonâ€™s claws. You had tried to remove it but Viserion was too tender and snapped whenever you touched it. â€œIâ€™m sorry; I should never have put you in harmâ€™s way.â€  Viserion leans forward and allows you to rub his nose.  â€”  Holding out your arms tears of happiness fall from your eyes as the midwife places your newborn babe into your arms. She was tiny and perfect. One of the handmaidens comes over with a cloth but you shake your head and smile â€œIâ€™ll do it.â€  Taking the lukewarm cloth you clean your daughterâ€™s face and body making sure to dip the cloth into the bowl of water Clara holds for you so the fabric doesnâ€™t become dry and rough.  â€œShe is a beautiful princess.â€  â€œThat she is. Can you send for prince Jacaerys?â€  â€œRight away princess.â€  Jacaerys had waited in the room with you but with Aemma fussing and screaming because she couldnâ€™t understand why she wasnâ€™t allowed in you told Jace to go and comfort her. The babe scrunches her face up and you unlace the top of your nightgown with one hand and pull it down. You place the babe against your bare chest and she finds your breast and starts feeding.  When the door opens youâ€™re greeted by Jace who looks completely mesmerized and Aemma who is holding his hand and trying to stand high enough to see over the bed. He picks her up and asks "are we going to meet your new sibling?â€  She nods excitedly.  â€œItâ€™s a girl.â€  â€œA girlâ€ he repeats tears brimming in his eyes. â€œLetâ€™s go meet your little sister Aemma.â€ When they reach the bed he kisses the side of her head and then places her on the bed. â€œRemember to be gentle with your mummy and the babe.â€  Since you were in the middle of the bed Aemma cuddled up on one side of you and Jacaerys came around and sat on the opposite side. He cups your cheek and says â€œIâ€™m so proud of you.â€  â€œDo you want to hold her once sheâ€™s finished feeding?â€  Jace looks confused that you even asked but he knew it wasnâ€™t personal. He knew a few good years of a healthy marriage couldnâ€™t undo all the trauma and neglect youâ€™d suffered at the hands of Aegon; it would just take time. â€œOf course especially since mother and Luke will be desperate for a cuddle.â€  â€œKepa whatâ€™s the babyâ€™s name?â€  Jace smiles softly. â€œWe decided to wait until we knew if it was a boy or girl before picking.â€  â€œI thought of one Rhaenys. Our grandmother has lost so much and has always been so strongâ€¦ but if you donâ€™t like itâ€”â€  â€œI love itâ€ Jace puts his arm around your shoulder and the warmth you feel radiating from him feels as if itâ€™s healing whatever the greens broke inside you. â€œMy little Reni is another daughter to dote on. Sheâ€™s perfect; all three of you are.â€  â€œPrincess? Princess! Prince Jacaerys Iâ€™ve found her!â€  When your tired eyes flutter open and you see a figure coming towards you it takes a few seconds for your eyesight to come into focus and you can recognise the person as Ser Erryk. The feeling of warmth you felt while dreaming was Viserion wrapping his wing around you shielding you from the wind and rain as you leaned against his body. Your stubborn dragon had refused to fly back to the dragonpit so you remained by his side.  Viserion roars when the knight approaches and prevents him from getting any closer. You rub at your dragonâ€™s side gently and hum â€œItâ€™s okay itâ€™s okay.â€  â€œLyarra! Lyarra!â€  Being so familiar with Jace Viserion that he only lets out a low grumble when he approaches slowly he knew not to startle a wounded dragon. You get to your feet and sway slightly. â€œJace my love youâ€™re safe.â€  â€œI thought Iâ€™d lost you. Ser Erryk inform the queen princess Lyarra has been found. Iâ€™m taking her to a carriage; she needs to see a maester right away.â€  â€”  When you feel something brushing across your forehead you automatically raise your hand and snatch it. When your eyes open you immediately let go. â€œForgive me Elinda. Iâ€¦â€ You take in your surroundings; in the confusion of waking up youâ€™d forgotten youâ€™d returned to the red keep the night before. â€œI was unsure of where I was.â€  She gives you a sympathetic look and speaks in a hushed voice â€œItâ€™s okay princess; youâ€™ve been through a lot. I was attempting to wipe the dried blood off your head without waking you.â€  â€œWhere is my mother?â€  â€œHer grace is watching over the young princeâ€™s in the queenâ€™s quarters. Would you like me to tell her youâ€™re awake?â€  â€œYes thank you.â€  With Elinda no longer standing in front of you you see Jace sleeping in one of the chairs facing the bed. His face was covered in cuts and bruises but he didnâ€™t appear to have any serious injuries. Swinging your legs out of bed you put pressure on your burned hand and whine waking him.  â€œLyarra.â€ Jace rushes over to you and presses his lips against yours. â€œIâ€™m so sorry I could proâ€”â€  â€œDonâ€™t I donâ€™t want to hear it; you are the reason Iâ€™m still hereâ€ you say softly. â€œWe are all alive and thatâ€™s all that matters. How is Baela?â€  â€œHeartbroken the dragon keepers on Dragonstone donâ€™t think Moondancer will recover from her injuries. Iâ€™m just thankful Baela was able to jump into the water before hitting the ground.â€  A crossbow pierced Moondancerâ€™s wing causing the dragon and rider to fall from the sky. The men on the ships started firing at Baela when she tried to swim ashore but Daemon burned them all. â€œAnd you? Your eye has swollen since last night.â€  â€œIt doesnâ€™t hurt and Iâ€™m more concerned about you.â€ He looks down at your hand which is now wrapped in white bandages. â€œSunfyre came out of nowhere and Vermax flew down low to escape him after his tail was bitten. When we came back up the first thing I saw was you being burned.â€  â€œTis only my hand; besides I needed a war wound. I could not simply be outdone by my husband having a battle scar and I donâ€™t.â€  Jace laughs and kisses your forehead then the tip of your nose.  â€œI canâ€™t believe I told mother to stay thinking I was protecting her and in the end it was her that saved us. Any word on how Viserion is?â€  â€œWith the help of Daemon the dragon keeper eventually managed to remove the wings from his claws but they needed to remove one of the nails so Viserion will need plenty of time to rest.â€  â€œAnd Vermax?â€  A smile tugs on his lips. â€œEven more ill-tempered but they assure me heâ€™ll heal.â€  â€œIâ€™m glad. We ought to send a raven to Cregan expressing our gratitude and letting him know we will be coming for our children.â€  â€œIâ€™ve already sent a raven letting him know the war is over so the Northerners no longer need to march south and Iâ€™ve said Clara is to return with our children. The maester said you canâ€™t travel with stitches on your head.â€  Resting your forehead against his chest you mumble and tears of happiness start to roll down your cheeks knowing your family would be together again soon. â€œI know weâ€™ve just been through a lot but I need you to do something for me.â€  â€œAnything my love.â€  â€œSentence Larys Strong to death.â€  â€”  â€œYou stand accused of murder. You stand accused of treason. How do you answer these charges?â€  Standing in the middle of the dragonpit Larys looks unfazed; he simply shrugs. Perhaps he no longer cares since he knows his fate is doomed. A tiny part of you was fearful his death would set something he had prearranged in motion. But he needed to answer for his crimes.  Jace tightens his grip on the hilt of his sword. â€œIn the name of Queen Rhaenyra Targaryen first of her name queen of the Andals the Rhoynar and the First Men Lady of the Seven Kingdoms and Protector of the Realm I hereby sentence you to death on the charges of being a traitor to House Targaryen and for the murder of Lord Lyonel Strong and Ser Harwin Strong.â€  Vermax walks out of the shadows of the dragon pit and looms over Larys.  â€œDracarys.â€  You glance at your mother and see the grief on her face. This wouldnâ€™t bring Harwin back but you hoped the truth being known would help her Jacaerys and Joffrey have closure one day. There had been rumors for years that the clubfoot was involved in the deaths of his own father and brother but it wasnâ€™t until you sentenced Otto to death and saw the look in his Larys eyes that you knew it was true.  â€”  A small feast was held in honor of the rightful heir finally sitting on the throne with the council members who supported your motherâ€™s claim in attendance but as the hall started to thin out you wanted to go to bed but you didnâ€™t want to ruin Jacaerys night; even if you left alone he would follow you. Glancing in his direction you smiled. Jace was speaking with your grandsire while holding Joffrey who had fallen asleep.  Daemon sits down fills half a cup of wine and pushes it in front of you. â€œBloodshed is not an easy thing to digest. You can speak freely with me.â€  â€œIâ€™m glad they died together.â€  â€œYou and the queen took two enemies out at once.â€  â€œThey say when we die our dragons mourn us but they can bond with another rider. That wouldnâ€™t have happened with Sunfyre.â€ You take two large gulps of wine finish the cup and wipe the residue off with the back of your hand. â€œSailors would sing songs about a dragon with golden scales that glisten in the sunlight that would haunt the shores of Dragonstone; they would claim to still hear its cries while it searched for its rider.â€  â€œThe dragons have no control over what side they are on but the usurper was a cunt long before he stole your motherâ€™s throne.â€  â€œI know what he isâ€”was but hearing songs being sung about his death by drunken fools doesnâ€™t feel right. Itâ€™s exactly what they did when Lucerys died.â€  He strokes your cheek â€œand one day they will move on and find another death to sing about.â€  Daemon kisses the back of your head before going to join your mother who is waving him over. It was the first time in a long time that she seemed genuinely happy.  â€œNot a fan of the wine princess?â€  â€œNo itâ€™s revolting.â€ Wine was something you never drank unless it was watered down. You smile when Jace sits down beside you; it was only you and him now sitting at the Queenâ€™s high table. â€œWhere has Joffrey gone?â€  â€œElinda has taken the little prince to his chambers.â€ He glances around the room and quietly says â€œIt almost feels surreal doesnâ€™t it? Everything that has happened.â€  You rub small circles on the back of Jacaerys hand with your thumb. â€œWhat do we do now my prince?â€  â€œWe wait for our children to come home.â€     Iksa se jorrÃ¢elagon hen nuha abrar â€” you are the love of my life  Umbagon gida â€” stay calm  Jikagon st se tikuni â€” go for the wings

post_body: I donâ€™t like Cole but itâ€™s very annoying how TB stans try to justify hating him while loving Daemon despite him having the same ugly flaws.  â€œAt least Deamon owns up to who he is and doesnâ€™t act like a self-righteous holier-than-thou hypocritâ€  Daemon is a Targaryen supremacist ğŸ˜­ğŸ˜‚  How can anyone be more of a self-righteous holier-than-thou hypocrit than the one who believes â€œI am closer to godhood than humanityâ€?   Daemon is not shameless about his evil actions because heâ€™s a super honest person who hates hypocrisy. Itâ€™s because heâ€™s a Targaryen supremacist who believes heâ€™s entitled to do these evil actions. Supremacist jerks are the biggest hypocrites out there. â€œI can do horrible shit to anyone but no one has the right to do any horrible shit to me but I am simply superiorâ€.   He doesnâ€™t â€œown up to who he isâ€ because he doesnâ€™t even think heâ€™s amoral or a bad person! Just like how white supremacists never considered themselves amoral or bad when they committed atrocities against non-white people.  Hypocrisy born out of a shamed and guilt-ridden consciousness is way more forgivable than an honesty born out of supremacist arrogant and shameless depravity.

Nevertheless the Targaryen family was split in two: one side wore black the other green. However it seemed that the Dragon Family had not just split in two but shattered like a broken glass. Next to him was his mother then the Hand of the King. On the new kingâ€™s left sat Aemond followed by their two younger sisters. No one exchanged even a glance. The girl nodded and they went to the motherâ€™s chambers.  â€œHas something happened?â€ the young princess asked once they were alone. The woman quickly reached for a jug of wine and filled her goblet taking several large sips. The alcohol however did not ease the knot in her throat. Alicent clutched the goblet in her hand and sat down looking at her daughter. She stared at her for a few moments in silence as if trying to memorize as many details of her as possible. If she could she would have imprinted her image on her mind.  â€œMotherâ€”â€ â€œYou will go northâ€ Alicent interrupted her declaring it like a crossbow bolt. She knew this revelation would not be easy for her. Accepting the news would be equally difficult for her daughter.  â€œWhat?â€ the girl frowned. â€œMe? To the North?â€  The woman nodded and sighed wanting to gather some courage and convince herself that what she was doing was right.  â€œYou know well that war is coming and even if we wanted to it is inevitableâ€ she returned her gaze to her daughterâ€™s face who was looking at her with a slight frown between her brows. â€œWe need allies and the most are in the North. We must forge an alliance with them.â€  â€œWhy are you entrusting me with such task?â€ she asked shaking her head. â€œI understand you wonâ€™t send Aegon but Aemond? Ser Criston?â€  Alicent tightened her grip on the goblet and if it had been made of a weaker material it would have shattered in her hand by now.  â€œOnly you can bring the North closer to us.â€  The young princess frowned even more and shook her head. She didnâ€™t understand any of this.  â€œAm I to go there alone?â€ she looked back at her mother who only nodded. â€œHow long am I to be there?â€  â€œYou will marry Cregan Starkâ€ she announced placing the goblet on her lap. â€œThere is no stronger alliance than marriage. Rhaenyra can do nothing about it.â€  The girl scoffed in disbelief and took a few steps back.  â€œThis is absurd utter madnessâ€ she believed her mother was joking but the womanâ€™s face still had the same expression. â€œBut you promised me to Aegon!â€  â€œAegon broke off the engagementâ€ she said looking at her daughterâ€™s face. â€œHe knows it is necessary.â€  The young princess laughed bitterly and tears hot as molten steel streamed down her cheeks.  â€œThe North will not stand with a usurper you know that very well!â€  â€œLord Stark is extremely pleased with the prospect of marrying a Targaryen and eagerly awaits youâ€ she said almost mechanically. She had been repeating this sentence nonstop for days as if trying to convince herself that what is she doing was right. However she couldnâ€™t bear to look at her daughterâ€™s tear-streaked bitter face.  â€œYouâ€™re a monsterâ€ she sobbed turning and grabbing the door handle.  â€œWe all must sacrifice for the greater goodâ€ she said but her daughter no longer heard her.  The shaken princess hurriedly left the castle heading to the Dragonpit. She sobbed bitterly tears streaming down her cheeks. When she heard Vermithor she quickened her pace running. When she saw the dragon her heart momentarily lifted. It broke however when she saw the massive collar around the beastâ€™s neck and the heavy chain that bound it. She cried out reaching out and touching the dragonâ€™s snout.  â€œWhat have they done to you?â€  The bronze giant looked weakened likely given a massive dose of something to sedate him during the collaring. The young princess couldnâ€™t believe what her own family was capable of.  â€œThere itâ€™s alrightâ€ she ran her hands over his snout though she herself was shattered into pieces. Sadness grief and despair mixed with fury. She walked around the dragon and stood before the collar clasp grabbing the chain and pulling with all her strength. But even with that it didnâ€™t budge. I will return when my time comes and together we will burn all those who did this to us.)  She walked away not looking back. She heard the dragonâ€™s roar and cry the clanking of chains and the flapping of wings. But she left the Dragonpit alone.  At the castle gates two carriages and about four dozen knights waited all on horses and in shining armor. Alicent waited by one carriage accompanied by the Hand of the King. Fearing the princess planned to starve herself to death they tried to persuade her to eat at least small amounts. Sometimes they succeeded sometimes not.  As a result the girl lost a lot of weight during the journey. Her dresses became too large her eyes sunken and her hair once like glowing gold now resembled spider silk. The princess stopped spending the journey in tears only when the entourage passed Harrenhal. She remained silent and the feasts thrown by the lords to host her were always the first she left apologizing and explaining a headache. No one blamed her.  As the entourage moved further the days grew shorter and the nights colder. Winterfell was near but the approaching winter was even nearer.  The Targaryen princess reached the northern capital after over two moons.  At the maidâ€™s suggestion the girl donned a thick fur coat and as soon as she stepped outside her carriage she was greeted by piercing cold. She had seen snow on the journey but there was much more of it here and it still fell from the sky. Lead-colored clouds hung low and snowflakes swirled in the wind falling onto the icy ground. They also fell on her snow-like hair which the frosty wind blew kissing her cheeks in greeting.  Cregan Stark the young lord of Winterfell and her future husband also came to greet her.  The young man was the textbook definition of a Northerner. He was only a little older than her but his sharp features made him appear more mature than he actually was. The Wolf of the North was over a head taller than her with broad shoulders and a well-built physique now covered under a thick fur. The wind tousled his shoulder-length brown hair and his toughened skin was impervious to the cold. Not like the girlâ€™s cheeks now rosy as petals of a fresh bloomed flower.  â€œPrincessâ€ he spoke his voice deep and marked by an accent. â€œI welcome you to Winterfell.â€  â€œMy Lordâ€ she forced a smile though she knew it must have looked more like a grimace. He knew why the girl had been sent to him and what was expected of her; he had even heard rumors of a broken engagement. He decided not to pressure her and let her get used to the new place to the North. After all a Dragon had ended up among a pack of Wolves.  The wedding did not wait for the girl to get accustomed to Winterfell; it took place just a few days after her arrival at the Stark stronghold. The Dragon Princess had exchanged only a few formal sentences with the Lord of the North before she had to call him husband. The Godswood where the wedding was held had seen many a forced marriage. The girl had even come to terms with the bedding but the Young Wolf announced that it would not take place.  â€œPerhaps one day a spark of affection will ignite within you and you will come to my arms of your own accordâ€ he said when he saw the questioning look on her face.  The night after the wedding the marriage was spent apart. Every subsequent night was as well.  Days passed and the young princess gradually came to terms with her new reality. She knew this was her life now that she was the wife of the Wolf of the North and the Lady of Winterfell. The choice she had been forced into might not have pleased her but it did not mean it was a bad one.  After some time the girl began to spend more time outside her chambers. She abandoned reading and took up sewing helping the servants mend linens and clothes. She insisted on mending her husbandâ€™s clothes herself asking that no one else do it for her. Although it was not her duty every morning and evening she fed the animals. The young princess missed her dragon dearly but she found joy in spending time with horses feeding chickens or petting rabbits.  One of the servants once ran terrified to inform Cregan that the princess was endangering herself with the direwolves. The Lord worried quickly went with her to the scene only to find there was no reason for concern. The girl sat motionless on the ground allowing the animals to sniff her. Two wolves wagged their tails and one even lay down beside her. Creganâ€™s heart swelled at the sight not because of her interaction with the animals but because for the first time he saw a smile on her face. He could have sworn it was genuine. Both morning and evening he would ask the servants how the girl was doing. After some time the young princess began to do the same.  â€œWhat is he like?â€ she asked one day while she and two Winterfell servants were mending clothes. Lord Stark is very kind.â€  The girl lowered her gaze focusing on her work. She smiled slightly.  â€œI think he is a good man tooâ€ she admitted.  â€œThat does not mean he can be trifled withâ€ added the other. â€œHe is kind when someone gives him the same. But he is a wolf my lady. He can bite if provoked.â€  Indeed Cregan appeared to be a man of steel nerves who could turn that steel into a sword with which he could take a life without a second thought. For the first time since they met and got married they had the chance to learn something about each other.  â€œIâ€™ve never seen a dragonâ€ Cregan admitted. His sword lay by his straightened legs and he leaned his back against the rough wall.  â€œI wish you to never have toâ€ the girl replied. Her legs were crossed and in them like in a nest slept little Vermithor. â€œDragons never bode well.â€  â€œBut still they obey youâ€ he looked at her. â€œHow do you manage that?â€  â€œYou canâ€™t control them completely; they are still wild beastsâ€ she noted. â€œBut the Targaryens have managed to do so to some extent for thousands of years back when the home of dragons was Valyria.â€  â€œDragons respond only to the old language right?â€ The young princess nodded in confirmation. â€œJust as Iâ€™ve never seen a dragon Iâ€™ve never encountered that language.â€  â€œZyr sindighy iderÄ“bion kes as qogralbarâ€ she said and the Young Wolf smiled. â€œSe valzi rijinyso sizi vysÌ„oronâ€ (It is a very rough language in my opinion. And also not the easiest to learn)  â€œIf I were a dragon and heard something like that I wouldnâ€™t hesitate to follow ordersâ€ he replied making her laugh. Cregan also smiled sincerely. He never thought heâ€™d hear the language of Old Valyria but even more he didnâ€™t expect to hear such sincere laughter of the Dragon Princess.  Winter began to settle more and more into Winterfell but the biting cold was defied by the spark of affection that blossomed between the Wolf and the Dragon.

post_body: â€œBut I was not told his saviour was so comely.â€   But I was not told it was you. I knew of you. But you were faceless. A thought. A betrayal. Now I see your face. I see his face. You are like him. You are your fatherâ€™s son. Corlysâ€™s son. There can be no mistake. I have made no mistake.   How can I ever hate that which has his face? Which has features of my own children? Are you his saviour? Will you be; his saviour his heir? You are my deepest wound made flesh. A shadow now solid beneath my hands. A living breathing reminder now trembling under my touch as if you think I will throttle you when all I can think is that I cannot believe you are real.  And what has he done? What has Corlys done to us both?
