post_body: about children and trouble summary: It is reported that in the year 121 AC when the Realmâ€™s Jewel was only six summers old her hatchling Merrax was eaten by the Cannibal in a strange turn of events that found him moving from Dragonstone to the Dragonpit in Kingâ€™s Landing. Princess Rhaenyra demanded to have the dragonâ€™s head cut but as nobody ever tried nor dared to get close to the Cannibal it was impossible to do it. Thus her daughter took the matters into her own hands.  pairings: cregan stark x velaryon!reader (no use of y/n) platonic (familial) relationship between the targs/velaryon and reader  word count: 8.2k   warnings: cregan being harassed by a six year old tantrums mentions of death reader being young rhaenyra come back to life overall pretty chill?  authorâ€™s note: man do i love writing about reader annoying cregan.  previous | next | series masterlist  <!-- more --> You spend the month before your sixth nameday on Driftmark with your paternal grandparents and the other Velaryon family members.  There your grandparents shower you with gifts presenting you with a beautiful headpiece made of pearls and seashells that you fall in love with and a new array of clothes â€” all embroidered with diamonds and pearls most in the sea-blue colour of the Velaryon emblem.  â€œWe started out as fishermenâ€ Corlys tells you one day holding you in his arms and motioning to the vastness of the sea beyond Blackwater Bay. â€œThen we became sailors then explorers then merchants. Then we took what was rightfully oursâ€“ Driftmark and a title. But never forget where you came from little one. We owe the sea too much to discard it.â€  You like the sea almost as much as you like riding dragons. You and your grandfather take swims together when it gets too hot taking your time to cool off before going back to the castle trying to hold in your laughter and hide from the wrath of Rhaenys who isnâ€™t too fond of the idea of her granddaughter being wet like a dog. And since her husband isnâ€™t getting any younger either and constantly complains about aching limbs then maybe he shouldnâ€™t dive into Blackwater Bay like itâ€™s a hot bath too.   When she isnâ€™t preoccupied in reprimanding you and her husband for being childish your grandmother Rhaenys takes you on long rides on Meleys the Red Queen who has taken a liking in you and seeks your caresses every time you are near. You like the air brushing your face and hair and the enormous castle becoming almost small from how much high up you two are.   Your father and grandfather make sure to start teaching you all they know about boats and navigating through the sea. You ask them when your brothers will be able to join you all and they tell you that once they near their sixth nameday theyâ€™ll take them out to the sea too; teach them everything they know just as theyâ€™re doing with you. You cannot wait for Jace and Luke to be able to share this with you because the sea has never felt more like home than right now.   As you lean over the edge of the boat you let your hand brush over the surface of the water looking at your grandmother in complete awe. â€œWe have to do this more often grandmother I canâ€™t remember ever having this much fun in my life.â€  She laughs then a rich sound coming right from her heart and pinches your nose eyes tender and loving. â€œAh is that so my sweet? Then Iâ€™ll be expecting a lot of visits from you once you claim your own dragon.â€   You perk up. â€œI promise the first time I fly on a dragon it will be to come here and visit you and grandfather.â€  You catch your first fish that day â€” a little thing that could barely fill even the stomach of a child â€” and your grandfather takes you in his arms and promises that soon he will buy you your own boat â€” after all the feast for your sixth summer is only a sennight away. Itâ€™s also the first time you hold a real sword in your hands and as you almost â€” and by accident â€” cut off Corlysâ€™ nose your father laughs his ass off and promises that soon enough heâ€™ll start training you to be able to manage a real blow with the blade.  Two days later you all depart on dragonback for Kingâ€™s Landing; and even if Corlys has always been hesitant about riding on Meleys with his wife your laughs while you sat in front of your father on Seasmoke definitely eased his nerves. Itâ€™s a relatively short ride to the Dragonpit as you leave in the morrow right after breaking your fast and by the late afternoon youâ€™re already in the Crown Lands.   Waiting for you in the Dragonpit are your mother and the King a smile on their faces Viserys with his arms open waiting for a hug.   You get off of Seasmokeâ€™s wing slipping like itâ€™s some sort of slide as your father yells at you to please be careful then immediately call out for your grandsire while running up at him. â€œAh my dear granddaughter!â€ he exclaims holding out his arms and catching you as you jump in them. He tries his best not to grunt from the effort. â€œHave you been good to your father Lord Corlys and Rhaenys?â€  You excitedly nod snuggling into his shoulder and even if his knees and back are screaming for mercy since his health is getting worse and his muscles more frail he refuses to accept that his precious girl is growing up â€” so much that in a few months he wonâ€™t be able to pick her up anymore.   Rhaenyra raises an eyebrow at your apparent lack of care about her presence. â€œWhat am I chopped liver?â€  You hold out a hand and pat it against her shoulder almost like youâ€™re saying sorry. You still donâ€™t budge from your grandsireâ€™s arms. She doesnâ€™t seem to hold it against you taking your little palm in hers and placing a kiss on it. She brushes your hair out of your face as you close your eyes yawning.   She chuckles. â€œTired my love?â€   You nod eyes teary from the sleepiness. Your mother then eases you out of your grandsireâ€™s arms without too many protests holding you close against her chest. â€œThen we better go to bed as soon as we get back to the Keep sweetling.â€  It seems you donâ€™t like this idea. â€œDonâ€™ wannaâ€ you mumble barely squirming not even managing to formulate properly a sentence. â€œI wanna play with Jace and Luke and andâ€¦ and train with them and dad. Grandma says sheâ€™s goinâ€™ to teach me how to sew dresses for Emya and Melissa like auntie Helaena does and grandpa wants to take me with him to sail across the seas.â€  Emya and Melissa are your favourite dolls â€” just two of the dozens you have the ones you gift to all the outfits Helaena sews for practice. Soon enough sheâ€™ll have to start learning how to do that too your mother thinks not without a pang of sadness in her heart. How time flies. â€œYouâ€™ll have time to sail with Corlys and learn from Rhaenys how to sew once you get older sweetling. About your father and your brothersâ€¦ well they arenâ€™t going anywhere any time soon.â€   She isnâ€™t surprised to see you pass out in her arms not even a few minutes later and by the time the carriage stops at the Keep youâ€™re dead asleep. She lays you in your bed and tucks you in for the night thinkingâ€“ My little girl soon enough will be a big girl. But then she ponders that you could never be too big for her to stop considering you her little girl.   The next day is spent catching up with your brothers; mostly Luke who apparently took your absence particularly bad and is now set on always having at least a hand on you â€” and that is when he doesnâ€™t straight up wrap his body around one of your legs hence you having to limp through the Red Keep with your little brother chained to your leg.   Thankfully Rhaenys is quick to put an end to this madness demanding the prince to stop harassing you since youâ€™re not going anywhere for a while. Lucerys departs from your leg â€” not without any protests â€” and lets you be even if in the next few days heâ€™s still pretty clingy â€” not that you would ever mind. Heâ€™s still your little brother and you give him all the hugs and cuddles he wants even if sometimes youâ€™d rather be by yourself or with just Heleana without getting interrupted every single minute.   When you bring it up to her she shrugs. â€œI would pay to have brothers like that you know. Be thankful for what you have.â€ Because my brothers are too stuck in their own misery to even care about me or notice my presence or absence.  You take her hand and squeeze it then hug her tight. â€œBut you have meâ€ you reply. â€œâ€˜Tis not much maybe but I can try.â€ Helaena only shakily hugs you back not saying anything. She usually doesnâ€™t like hugs but this one feels strangely comforting.   (You donâ€™t know how much she cried that night thinking about how she wishes you were her sister and not a niece her mother despises. But itâ€™s probably better this way because maybe if you were born as her sister you wouldnâ€™t be as loved as you are â€” and she canâ€™t even imagine you being in her situation always discarded by your family. Maybe you would become as careless as Aegon or as closed off as Aemond. Maybe itâ€™s a blessing you werenâ€™t borne out of Alicent Hightower.   Then she prays that in another lifetime you two are borne out of the same mother a mother as loving as Rhaenyra and she gets to be your older sister without having to ask anyone for permission to have a hug from you.)  The day of your name day finally arrives and with it the feast your grandsire has organised in the last two months. It is a grand affair with almost all the lords from the Seven Kingdoms present and your parents honestly have no idea where theyâ€™re going to put all the gifts youâ€™ll receive.   You sit right beside your grandsire between him and your mother wearing the pearl headpiece your grandparents gifted you and an aqua blue dress that has been tailor made for the occasion. Every now and then a Lord gets up from his table to bring their felicitations to you and your family but you know itâ€™s just a way to somehow get to talk to your grandsire about their matters.  Most of them are old and boring and Viserys dismisses them without even a spare glance towards their problems set on having a good time at least during your celebrations. You donâ€™t pay them much mind either focused on the food and all the gifts that youâ€™ll get to unwrap in the next few days â€” that is until a guy more or less of Aemondâ€™s age comes over.   The first thing Rhaenyra does â€” after thinking what the hell do they feed children in the North for them to be this big? â€” is nudging her husband on the ribs and nodding towards the boy. â€œLooks like he got a new buckle. Letâ€™s hope she doesnâ€™t steal that one too.â€  Heâ€™s grown since the last time sheâ€™s seen him. He should be ten maybe eleven summers old now but looks a bit older â€” northerners and their fucking genes. His dark hair is shorter he has a ceremonial dagger strapped on his belt and this time he definitely looks like a Little Lord.   â€œMy Kingâ€ he bows then nods to you and bows again. â€œMy Princess I wished to congratulate you on your sixth nameday and excuse my father for his absence. Unfortunately he fell ill just before the departure to Kingâ€™s Landing so he sent me in his stead.â€œ He raises his head and looks again at you â€œTo a hundred of these days my Princess.â€  Youâ€™ve got the same look you had when you first saw him as a babe even if Rhaenyra is sure that you donâ€™t remember even seeing him. She isnâ€™t even sure you know who he is but youâ€™re already blushing and swinging your legs under the table.   â€œAh youâ€™re Lord Rickonâ€™s sonâ€“ Cregan am I right?â€ Viserys looks over to his daughter for confirmation and she nods. The boy nods too. â€œYes Your Majesty. Unfortunately he had to stay in the North.â€   â€œYes yes â€˜tis no problemâ€ Viserys waves a hand at him â€œSend him my regards. Last year your mother died â€” and so did your brother the year before am I right? Another tragedy in the North is the last thing we want.â€ he grimaces at his bad phrasing which clearly sounded better in his head. The boy doesnâ€™t react but he knows that if he wasnâ€™t the King he probably would already have that beautiful ceremonial knife up his throat.   Rhaenyra coughs. â€œWhat the King means to sayâ€ she interjects â€œis that we wish you our deepest condolences and will pray so that Lord Rickon can get a fast recovery.â€   Cregan bows his head and half-smiles. â€œThank you my Princess.â€   â€œIs it as cold in the North as they say?â€ you suddenly ask him tone full of child-like awe.   The boy winces and Rhaenyra just knows heâ€™s getting flashbacks of that one time when you tried to make him bald. â€œErmâ€¦ yes it is. Thereâ€™s snow all year.â€   â€œOne day Iâ€™ll make sure to bring you thereâ€ your grandsire briefly cuts in not wanting to bother the Little Lord any longer. He smiles at him nodding â€œI hope you enjoy the rest of the evening boy.â€  Cregan doesnâ€™t have to be told twice because by the time heâ€™s finished bowing heâ€™s already sprinting to the table he left earlier. You pout staring at him while he sits back down between some other northern lords and you hear your mother laugh. â€œWhy the long face sweetling?â€  You look up at her. â€œIs the North far away?â€ you do have geography lessons but something like distance is still a pretty hard concept to understand.   Rhaenyra raises an eyebrow amused. â€œThe North or where the boy comes from?â€ You blush and keep your head down â€œWhy where the boy comes from of courseâ€  Your mother laughs. â€œIâ€™d say that Winterfell isâ€¦ maybe a little more than a moon by carriage far from here.â€ your face falls â€œBut itâ€™s a day or two by dragon.â€   You perk up. â€œWhen can I claim Merrax?â€  Rhaenyra almost falls out of the chair laughing at this. It seems that the first love is never truly forgotten even if you donâ€™t even remember him. â€œSoon enough sweetling.â€   Not much long after the bards pick songs you can dance to; your grandsire offers you his hand to open the dances even if he isnâ€™t in the best conditions to do so and you gleefully accept. You share a dance with him even if it has to be cut short because of him not feeling the best and happily swap him for your grandparents who like to twirl you around until youâ€™re dizzy.   You canâ€™t even sit down before your brothers grab your hands and drag you to the dancefloor once again demanding a dance with their sister too and itâ€™s only when the bards choose a slower song that you finally manage to sit down and catch a breath. That is until you see the boy.   Cregan Stark is about to retire for the night when he catches the scare of his life.   â€œI have a buckle like that too.â€  He barely manages to hold back a yelp eyes snapping behind him just to see you bashfully looking at him hands behind your back and on your tiptoes. He presses a hand on his chest regaining himself. â€œPrincessâ€ he says but it sounds a bit breathless. â€œYes I remember. I gave you that buckle six years ago.â€   You tilt your head. â€œAh really?â€  He nods. â€œYes at the feast for your birth. I remember it well.â€ I also remember how you terrorised me for a good part of the night.   You hum but donâ€™t seem to have anything to say for now. He feels awkward because he would gladly take his leave right now if it werenâ€™t for the fact that he can feel the eyes of the whole Royal Family on you two. Heâ€™s not sure he can go without having the permission to â€” your permission maybe â€” and the only thing his father advised him not to do was to cause a diplomatic incident.   (Meanwhile at the Royal table your grandfathers and Laenor are discussing the very thing happening before their eyes questioning what to do â€” and what you are trying to do.   â€œMaybe she just likes the buckle againâ€ Laenor hushes. â€œMaybe she wants another one.â€  â€œNo no Iâ€™m pretty sure sheâ€™s asking him if he is already betrothedâ€  Viserys and Laenor send a nasty glare to Corlys â€œSheâ€™s six I surely hope notâ€ mutters your grandsire worried about his little girl growing up and most of all getting interested in boys. Have you really already passed that phase where you think that boys are gross? Is he really getting that old?  â€œTen Gold Dragons that sheâ€™s waiting for him to ask her to dance.â€ Rhaenyra cuts in. Rhaenys nods taking a sip of her wine. â€œI would bet a hundred coins on that one.â€)  The music is slow and it almost drags the silence between you and the boy as you just stare at him. â€œI like this music.â€  â€œErm yesâ€ Cregan grimaces. He fears he knows where this is going. â€œIt is pretty lovely.â€  Another moment of silence passes. â€œI also really like dancingâ€ you add.   He sighs. Thereâ€™s really no escape now. â€œWould you mayhaps like to dance Princess?â€  You squeal girlish and childish and immediately take his hand to drag him with you to the dancefloor. You donâ€™t know the dance too well and your steps are a bit clumsy but your enthusiasm definitely makes up for it. At some point though his feet are begging for mercy after being stomped on for ten minutes so he takes the matters in his own hands and lifts you up enough for your tiptoes to rest upon his feet so that he has to dance and you just have to stay balanced.  You giggle blushing and looking up at him grinning. He has the terrible feeling that heâ€™s not getting out of here anytime soon.   (Viserys lets out a pained sigh thinking about his dear late wife. â€œShe looks so much like her grandmotherâ€   Corlys nods looking at Rhaenys. â€œShe does.â€)  People around you two are dancing and swirling too and they chuckle at Cregan sending him back to six years ago and making him feel a terrible deja-vu. At least sheâ€™s not pulling my hair anymore. He does have to admit that youâ€™re a bit cute though â€” you look so focused looking at his feet and trying to memorise the steps as best as you can. But the fact that youâ€™re cute doesnâ€™t mean he wouldnâ€™t have preferred going to sleep over dancing.   He finds his saviour in a servant who awkwardly stops your dance by bowing. â€œMy Princess my Lordâ€ the boy doesnâ€™t mind correcting him on the honorifice since he technically is here in the name of his father. The servantâ€™s voice has a certain urgency. â€œA raven has just arrived from Winterfell. Itâ€™s from Lord Rickon Stark.â€   Cregan nods â€œIâ€™ll come in a minuteâ€ heâ€™s already out of the dancefloor but then you tug on his cloak big doe eyes staring at him. â€œBut we have to finish our danceâ€   He sighs and from the corner of his vision he sees Laenor Velaryon coming to get you. â€œIâ€™m sorry Princess Iâ€™m sure thereâ€™ll be another time for us to dance againâ€ I hope not â€œBut now I really have to go.â€   Your lower lip trembles you let out a whine. Before he can even realise heâ€™s about to witness a grade eight type of meltdown Laenor saves the day. He comes up behind you taking your arms in his hands smiling as sweetly as he can. â€œI can dance with youâ€ he offers.   â€œBut I want to dance with himâ€   Your father tries to suppress a cry of horror from the fact that you donâ€™t want to dance with him â€” youâ€™ve never rejected a dance with him before now. This is a first. He looks at Cregan trying his best not to glare at him understanding that this is not a situation he will get out of easily. â€œWould you perhaps be interested in becoming a ward here boy?â€ he asks barely managing to stop you from squirming in his grip. â€œShe really likes you and you would have the chance to stay in the Crown Lands for the time being. It is a great opportunity.â€  At this point heâ€™s sounding desperate. Please stay here my daughter will throw a fit if you go away. It seems you have found yourself a new toy and unfortunately itâ€™s not one of the new gifts that the lords brought. â€œYou could be squire cupbearerâ€“ oofâ€ you land a particularly harsh blow on his ribs and he loses his breath for a moment â€œLord Commander of the City Watch anything you want.â€ he leans down so that heâ€™s more to his height â€œPlease.â€ he whispers all his desperation clear in his strained voice.   For some unknown reason you calm down in an instant. Laenor fears that if he looks at you youâ€™re going to start complaining again so his gaze remains on the boy who now looks terrified. Evidently he has understood that he has to run and fast. â€œUmâ€“ Iâ€“ Iâ€™m flatteredâ€ the Stark murmurs. â€œBut unfortunately Iâ€™ve got duties up in the North as heir aâ€“ and um a letter from my father has just arrived. So please excuse meâ€ he bows one last time before bolting out of the hall the servant in front of him.   Laenor sighs. He finally looks down at you disappointed andâ€“  â€œIs that a knife?â€ you put it behind your back before he can see better and try your best to resist his wrangling with one hand. It does not take much for your father to take the dagger out of your hands and realise it was the ceremonial dagger Cregan was carrying around before. He pales. â€œIs that why you stopped whining? How did you even get this?â€  You look away. â€œI donâ€™t know. I just took it.â€ you blush â€œIt was shinyâ€   It is of beautiful manufacture â€” the hilt is a direwolf much like the Starkâ€™s emblem and out of his mouth comes the blade. Your father sighs. â€œThis is bad sweetling. You donâ€™t get to steal from others am I clear? Tomorrow youâ€™ll apologise to Lord Cregan and youâ€™ll give it back to him.â€  You pout but it doesnâ€™t last long. Because your grandsire comes up behind you waving a hand at Laenor. â€œAw come on sheâ€™s just a child. If she likes it so much she can keep it. Iâ€™ll make sure to send the boy a dagger twice the worth of that one.â€  Your eyes shine looking up at your grandfather. â€œReally? I can keep it?â€   â€œOf course notâ€“â€  â€œOf courseâ€ your grandsire says and thatâ€™s all that matters because heâ€™s the King. You snatch the dagger from your father and run to Jace and Luke to show them your prize. Thatâ€™s the kind of reaction she has when we take away her dolls.â€ your mother shivers â€œMay the Gods help us all the day her first heartbreak comes through.â€  Rhaenyra surely didnâ€™t think your first heartbreak would have come so soon.   â€œHow is it possible?â€ she seethes arms crossed and a glare that could kill. Heâ€™s a wild dragon and second in size only to Vhagar soâ€“â€  â€œI want his headâ€ Rhaenyra declares. â€œAnd if I have to storm into the Dragonpit and kill him myself to do so then I will.â€  â€œMy Princess please reconsiderâ€ the keeper cries out. â€œThe Cannibal is one of the oldest dragons and is thought to be one of Balerionâ€™s offspringsâ€“ one of the only ones to have survived. Killing him would be likeâ€¦ like erasing a part of your familyâ€™s history!â€  â€œErasing a part of my familyâ€™s history?â€ Rhaenyra booms. â€œErasing a part of my familyâ€™s history?! At least she hadnâ€™t bonded yet with Merrax. She can still claim some other dragon orâ€“ orâ€“ another dragon could hatch before she is of age to claim one.â€   â€œShe is in the age of claiming one!â€ his wife rages. â€œI was seven summers when I claimed one and I made sure that she would be able to surpass me and become the youngest dragon rider at only sixâ€“ but of course the fucking Cannibal had to eat her dragon!â€  â€œPrincess Helaenaâ€™s hatchling was eaten tooâ€ the keeper whispers. â€œAnd even though he hatched at birth she never bonded with him and is instead bonded to Dreamfyre. The young Princess still has options.â€   â€œI donâ€™t care that she does I want the Cannibal dead!â€  It is quite late in the evening after the feast so all children should be asleep but you are not. You are in your auntâ€™s chambers near to your own playing with your dolls as Helaena hums songs and sews new dresses for you.   â€œAnd while the dragonâ€™s scales were as red as flamesâ€ she sings quietly â€œthe maidenâ€™s eyes were as blue as sapphiresâ€¦â€   The singing is easily tuned out by the screaming match that is happening outside probably down the hallway or in the gardens. You can hear the voice of your mother enraged and your father whoâ€™s just trying to calm her down.   You rise from the floor leaving your dolls there opening the door of the chamber and peeking an eye out. Ser Harrold Westerling stationed in front of the door is quick to notice you even as your mother screams and rages. â€œPrincessâ€ he whispers kneeling down. â€œYou should be asleep. Please get back insideâ€  Meanwhile your mother cries out â€œMerrax is dead! And with her another four dragons died all because youâ€™re too scared of a stupid wild dragon! Why should my daughter suffer because of your cowardice? Iâ€™ll slay the Cannibal myself if you donâ€™t dare to do so!â€   Both you and the knight stop in your tracks. Your breath hitches. Merrax isâ€¦ dead?   Youâ€™re just a child â€” you are yet to grasp the concept of death. You know the late Queen Aemma your grandmother is dead. She died giving birth to your uncle Baelon â€” who died too. You are a child surrounded by death yet not touched by it. You know the names of people who have died relatives and not â€” Alysanne Aemon Balerion Aemma Baelon â€” but they were all before you were born. Youâ€™ve never suffered a real loss.   â€œWhatâ€¦ what does it mean?â€ you ask Harrold trembling. â€œWhereâ€“ where did Merrax go? To Old Valyria?â€ your grandsire while telling you about Balerion the largest dragon in the world that he once rode said that when dragons died they went back there. â€œWe canâ€“ we can search for her right? Weâ€¦ we must.â€   Your mother is none the wiser about your presence down the hallway cursing in High Valyrian and threatening the dragon keeper. She dismisses the dragon keeper rushing to get you; Laenor takes you in his arms bidding his goodbyes to Harrold and Helaena holding you tight to his chest while walking towards your chambers. Youâ€™re awfully quiet shaking like a leaf eyes barred open despite the late hour.   Reaching your chambers Laenor sits you down on the settee by the fireplace kneeling down in front of you with Rhaenyra and holding your hand. Nobody is saying anything and it scares you. Somehow it makes it all feel more real. You whimper because it just canâ€™t be. â€œIâ€“ whereâ€¦ whereâ€™s Merrax?â€  â€œSweetlingâ€ your mother starts. â€œThereâ€™s a wild dragon known as the Cannibal that has been eating our hatchlings for centuries. We donâ€™t know how old he actually isâ€“ some say heâ€™s an offspring of Balerion your grandsireâ€™s late dragon and Vhagar. That would make him one of the two only dragons still alive to this day to have seen Old Valyria before the Doomâ€“ thatâ€™s why us Targaryens were always adamant about getting rid of him.â€  You know about the Cannibal â€” so why is she telling you this? â€œThe other reason is that nobody has ever managed to approach himâ€ your father adds. â€œHe eats everything that gets near him and often wanders to Dragonstone from Kingâ€™s Landing and vice versa. That is to say sweetlingâ€¦ thereâ€™s nothing we could have done to save her.â€   That is not true Rhaenyra thinks but it is best if the guilt rests on us rather than upon her.   â€œWhat does it mean?â€ you babble. â€œMerraxâ€¦ whereâ€¦â€  â€œMerrax has been eaten sweetlingâ€ says Rhaenyra ripping off the bandaid. â€œThe Cannibal has taken her.â€  You shake your head eyes filling with tears. â€œButâ€“ but she was mine!â€  â€œWe know sweetlingâ€“â€  â€œShe was born with me for me! She was my dragonâ€“ she had just started to eat from my hand!â€ now tears flow down your face as you weep cheeks blotchy and an angry red. â€œAm I supposed to live like Aemond from now on? Without a dragon bullied by Aegon and rejected by every hatchling? Whyâ€“ what will grandsire think of me? He was the last rider of Balerion and his only granddaughterâ€™s dragon died before she could even bond with her!â€  Your cries are now inconsolable and you reach for your parents falling into their arms on the floor with them. â€œYourâ€“ you gave me your riding clothes from when you were my age and had them tailored just for me but I canâ€™t wear them without a dragon! Iâ€™ll just look stupid!â€  Rhaenyra coos brushing your hair back from your face and kissing your temple. â€œCalm down my sweet. You shall not become like Aemond â€” you had not bonded yet with your dragon. And as much as Merraxâ€™s death pains me too â€˜tis not the end of the world. There are other hatchlings and adult dragons without a rider who are just waiting for the right Targaryen to claim them.â€   She kisses your eyes and cheeks wiping your tears. â€œAnd Iâ€™m sure at least one of them is waiting just for you.â€  You have a plan. â€˜Tis not really smart but you are six summers old and have a dream. A dream that your mother always reputed you capable of â€” becoming the youngest dragon rider surpassing her. Youâ€™re not about to let that dream go just because a stupid grandpa of a dragon ate your hatchling.  Until the Cannibal is back on Dragonstone your mother refuses to let you go to the Dragonpit insisting that heâ€™s already stayed for too long â€” surely heâ€™s about to go off his way again right?  (Apparently not. Helaena who wasnâ€™t forbidden from going to the pit said that the dragon keepers are worried: it seems the Cannibal is taking his time â€” waiting for something or someone.)  The plan is secretly going with Heleana to the Dragonpit right before supper. As she visits Dreamfyre you should be able to seek one of the hatchlings â€” and maybe one of them will take pity on you and allow you to ride them.   The first part goes pretty well. You get in the dragon riding attire your mother had gifted you and that she once wore â€” black with red embroidery displaying the Targaryen emblem on your chest â€” and just get in the carriage right next to Helaena. Ser Criston Cole the knight assigned to her for the afternoon doesnâ€™t even spare you a glance; he never does thatâ€™s why you chose today of all days to come with your aunt.   She is nervous fidgeting with her hands and playing with her rings. â€œAre you sure it wouldnâ€™t be wiser for you to stay in the Keep?â€ she asks worriedly. â€œIt doesnâ€™t matter if for a while you wonâ€™t have a dragon. I claimed mine just last year and Iâ€™m older than you.â€  You donâ€™t reply â€” youâ€™ve been rather silent in the last few days unlike your usual self. Rhaenyra finds it even worse than your tantrums â€” she wishes you would just get it out and scream instead of remaining as silent as a ghost your ramblings now an almost distant memory. They all just wish you could be the same as before the feast before Merrax was eaten.   The ride to the Dragonpit is short but awkward and you wonder how your mother will react once she realises you sneaked out. It probably wonâ€™t take her much longer to notice your absence so you have to either be quick or hide in the Dragonpit for the night if you wish to ride a dragon before your seventh name day.   As you exit the carriage a dragon keeper welcomes you and Helaena; he looks confused as to why youâ€™re here but quickly shakes it off guiding you two towards the caves where the dragons rest. He hesitantly sends a glance to you â€œThe hatchlings are also there â€” Dreamfyre has her own clutch and with the Cannibal near we prefer to keep them with their own parents so they may be protected.â€   You nod as he guides you into one of the caves a pretty light-blue and silver dragon chained in there. With Dreamfyre there are four hatchlings all much similar to her all sleeping and chained.   The keeper frees Dreamfyre from her chains and she immediately darts to Helaena gently nudging her with her snout. â€œRytsas issa hÄedarâ€ Hello my girl she says. You know the basics of Valyrian â€” your mother made sure you knew enough to be able to claim and ride a dragon even if itâ€™s not as fluent as youâ€™d like. You just understand it better than you speak it.   You watch the hatchlings as they start to rouse; thereâ€™s a pretty one with blue and red scales that you intend to approachâ€“   Then you hear something.   A low rumble coming from another cave one that shakes the whole pit. â€œThe Cannibalâ€ the dragon keeper mutters spitefully. â€œWhat a monster.â€   Well thatâ€™s too bad because youâ€™ve already lost interest in the hatchling you saw earlier and now your eyes are set on another possibility. The Cannibal.  No one ever managed to claim him and all that tried are long dead. He canâ€™t be killed as the other dragons know better than to get near him and thereâ€™s no amount of gold that could convince any man to try. Yet heâ€™s the one who killed Merrax the one to have killed the dragon that should have been yours; he owes you a debt and it has to be paid.   The dragon keeper is too preoccupied with Dreamfyre and her hatchlings to notice your absence and you are quick to snatch one of the torches on the walls to guide yourself through the various caves. You can feel the Cannibalâ€™s presence somehow; it haunts the pit hanging like a weight over the caves and suddenly you understand why the dragons have been so uneasy since his arrival. The air is heavy and smells of burnt flesh smoke lingering between the corridors.   The rumbling that you heard earlier is heard again and you know that heâ€™s near. And he is â€” only two caves away you find him.   Heâ€™s of a pitch black colour and is covered in spikes which â€” much like his tail â€” fade in a deep green. Some of his scales at the light of the fire shine of the same colour too; now you understand why heâ€™s thought of being the son of Balerion and Vhagar because if it werenâ€™t for the torch revealing his green shades youâ€™d think he was the Black Dread come back to life. Two horns rest above his eyes tipped backwards and almost pointing at his wings. Heâ€™s massive and itâ€™s clear that this cave wasnâ€™t meant for him as itâ€™s definitely much too small for his form. It was meant for the hatchlings â€” the hatchlings he ate.   He opens his eyes roused from his sleep and two gigantic emeralds stare down at you almost mockingly. He makes no move towards you nor tries to eat you so maybe thatâ€™s a good sign.   â€œYouâ€™re the Cannibalâ€ you whisper stupidly. â€œYouâ€™re the one who killed Merrax.â€  He barely grunts in response maybe uninterested in you maybe in assent.   You then understand that if you truly want to claim and ride a dragon then you must gather all the courage your little body can muster up and use it. â€œYou ate Merraxâ€ you state more firmly all the anger youâ€™ve felt in the last few days finally getting the best of you. â€œAo enkagon nyke iÄ gÄ“lÈ³n.â€ You owe me a debt.   This time he props his head up; he looks entertained almost as if heâ€™s betting on what youâ€™ll do. You canâ€™t hurt him â€” youâ€™re but a child â€” and you surely canâ€™t kill him. So what are you going to do?   Thereâ€™s a rack of rope near the entrance of the cave probably used for the hatchlings when they were still alive. You put down the torch leaving it on the sand of the pit and roll up the rope holding it between your arm and shoulder. The Cannibal has no saddle so youâ€™ll have to find a way not to fall off of him. Your motherâ€™s going to kill you if you do â€” but letâ€™s see if you live enough for her to be able to do that.   The climb to reach the top of the Cannibalâ€™s neck looks hard but youâ€™re stubborn and would rather die than let him go away with the fact that he ate Merrax. If you canâ€™t kill him then youâ€™re going to bother him for the rest of your life. So the only thing you can do is start climbing.   He seems confused by your doing as youâ€™re clinging to the spikes and scales trying to reach the top of his neck. He shakes it somewhat in a gentle manner and you fall on your butt not from high enough to actually hurt but from high enough to have a bruised ego.   â€œWhat is wrong with you?â€ you scream out angry. â€œYou killed my dragon the last thing you can do is replace her!â€  Your voice dies a little by the end because the Cannibal has gotten up and leant down opening his left wing almost inviting you to mount him. Youâ€™re completely weirded out but surely enough are not going to reject his offer.   Quickly getting up with the wing serving as some sort of stairs in a matter of mere minutes you find yourself on top of the Cannibal who looks like heâ€™s just waiting for you to say something. â€œOkay okayâ€ you mumble to yourself. Youâ€™re not scared â€” well not of him but of your mother. Oh once she hears about this youâ€™ll be grounded until youâ€™re ready to be wed.   With the rope you tie yourself to the dragon using his spikes to hold the cord firm onto his body. You give him a pat on the scales adjusting to the feeling of being so high up. â€œUmâ€¦ iÅrÄs?â€ you order him to stand but it sounds more like a question.   He does follow your demand though standing up straighter ready to get out. â€œWhoaâ€“ alright.â€ you hold onto the spikes tighter â€œWell I have to name you first big guy.â€  He turns his head to look at you almost confused. â€œI canâ€™t just keep calling you the Cannibal because I wonâ€™t let you eat any more hatchlings.â€ At this he grunts in disapproval but you go on telling yourself that he surely doesnâ€™t understand the common tongue and just wants to go against you. â€œMy mother calls all her dragonâ€™s hatchlings with names ending in ax because her mountâ€™s name is Syrax. So I could call you something likeâ€¦ I donâ€™t know Rhaerion?â€  He grumbles and you grimace. â€œI donâ€™t think you deserve your fatherâ€™s name though. You eat baby dragons while Balerion was loyal and obedient.â€ You search your brain for names Valyrian or not that would suit him before having the idea of a lifetime.  You know some basics of High Valyrian enough to make a dragon fly always says your mother. Helaena is pretty good at it Aemond is almost fluent and your brothers are still learning it. Your uncle Aegon instead is completely ignorant of it except for cursing words. He likes to call anyone an orvorta but he has a favourite cuss word usually used for your brothers â€” and while it makes you mad that he refers to them in such a way you have to admit that it is a name quite fitting for your dragon.   â€œYour name shall be NÄdrÄ“syâ€ you tell him. â€œThat is until you redeem yourself. Then I may decide to find you another name maybe a kinder one.â€   He roars shaking his head looking at you in disappointment. You can hear the dragon keepers shout your name in the corridors having finally noticed your absence â€” or maybe your presence since you shouldnâ€™t have been there since the beginning. You hold onto the dragonâ€™s spikes as hard as you can preparing yourself for some movement.   â€œJiÅragon hen hen kesÄ«r NÄdrÄ“sy!â€ you order with the same tone your grandsire uses while holding court. Get out of here.   He does as you ask moving on all fours with steps that make the Dragonpit shake. You see two keepers in front of you frozen in fear but itâ€™s not long before they start screaming and running away.   You get to the entrance of the Dragonpit and from where you sit you see a group of gold cloaks standing not too far away behind Ser Harwin Strong â€” who apparently barely notices the dragon behind him too preoccupied in screaming in Ser Criston Coleâ€™s face about how â€œitâ€™s all his fault that the princess is missingâ€ and how â€œthe King should have his headâ€.   While you never liked Cole too much as he seemed to despise you for no reason you didnâ€™t wish for him to be beheaded because of you. So you stop NÄdrÄ“sy and cupping your mouth with your hands you scream â€œSer Harwin! Iâ€™m here!â€   At first the Lord Commander doesnâ€™t understand where you are looking around and sending a glance at Cole that says this doesnâ€™t end here but once he sees you all the blood drains from his face as well as from the face of Ser Criston and the other knights. â€œPrincess!â€ he screams hysteric. â€œGet off of there itâ€™s dangerous! Your mother has been searching for you and sheâ€™s worried!â€  But it seems that you already canâ€™t hear him returning all your attention to your dragon. â€œGaomagon ao gÄ«migon skoriot Driftmark iksis?â€ you ask him. Do you know where Driftmark is?  You have all the intentions of keeping the promise you made to your grandmother about your first flight being one to visit her and Corlys on Driftmark. They had just gotten back a couple of days ago but youâ€™re sure that they would still be happy to see you. Right now you donâ€™t think about your parents too euphoric of finally having a dragon of your own as you are â€” and that will probably cost you another two years youâ€™ll have to spend grounded.   NÄdrÄ“sy roars loudly opening his wings and taking flight.   Not even ten hours later you find yourself on Driftmark under the worried glance of your grandparents who upon hearing your story are asking themselves if Rhaenyra has already thrown herself into madness. You happily show them your new acquaintance who unexpectedly purrs when you caress his snout and doesnâ€™t look like the Cannibal who ate countless of hatchlings.   â€œThatâ€™sâ€¦ thatâ€™s marvellous sweetheartâ€ Rhaenys is a bit shaken but still tries to be supportive. â€œDoes your mother perhaps know that youâ€™re here?â€   â€œOf course not! She would throw a fit otherwise.â€  All their fears are confirmed to be true and your grandmother immediately asks a servant for paper and pen to write to Kingâ€™s Landing. And as you tell them how you renamed the Cannibal Corlys pales thinking that with you being daughter of Rhaenyra you could have chosen something way worse. Heâ€™s just grateful that the common folk doesnâ€™t know High Valyrian.   Two days later a raven comes from Driftmark finally putting at ease the concerns of the whole court and stopping Rhaenyra and Laenor from getting any more grey hairs.   To King Viserys I Targaryen his daughter Princess Rhaenyra Targaryen and her husband Ser Laenor Velaryon.   The Princess (who you have been searching for I assume) has just landed on Driftmark. She is safe and sound thankfully and she rode ten hours on a dragon known for his wilderness without a saddle secured on him only by a cord. She renamed the Cannibal (funnily enough if you wish to know his name now is â€˜NÄdrÄ“syâ€™) who is now eating all the whales and sharks of the Narrow Sea that he can see from the island. We managed to put a saddle on him so that the next time sheâ€™ll ride him the chances of falling off his back are minimal and I will accompany her back to Kingâ€™s Landing on Meleys myself as soon as she takes a good rest and is able to get on the dragon again. Me and my husband took the liberty to give her an earful about her recklessness and irresponsibility but weâ€™re sure youâ€™ll choose a considerate punishment for her behaviour once she returns to Kingâ€™s Landing.    Yours truly Princess Rhaenys Targaryen.  Rhaenyra puts down the letter taking a deep breath telling herself that violence is not the answer. Unfortunately all she can think about is giving you two slaps at a time until the number becomes uneven.   Laenor sighs rubbing his eyes. They both havenâ€™t slept much in the last two days too worried to even think about stopping the research for you. â€œWell at least sheâ€™s alive.â€  To their grand surprise Viserys bursts out laughing. â€œSee?â€ he says to his daughter. â€œThatâ€™s what you put me through when you were young. Ooh youâ€™re in for at least twelve years of worrying and suffering. Rhaenyra my dear daughter Iâ€™m glad to announce that your daughter came out just like you.â€ he then rises from his seat laughing like a madman. â€œMy granddaughter is the youngest dragon rider in history!â€ he screams feeling as young as he hadnâ€™t felt in a while. â€œOh boy Iâ€™ll have to organise a whole other feast for this!â€  Meanwhile Rhaenyra just stares at the letter; sheâ€™s not surprised you sneaked out because thatâ€™s what she would have done in the same situation and she has to admit that there are some similarities between you and the way she was before having you. Thereâ€™s just one thing that almost makes her think that you really are a younger version of her come back from the past to haunt her for all the scares she gave her father during the years.  â€œBastardâ€ she mutters. â€œMy daughter out of all the proper names she could have chosen called her dragon Bastard.â€

post_body: the Sept scene was fully in character for Rhaenyra & Alicent Iâ€™ve seen fansâ€“even Rhaenicent fans!â€“saying it was ooc or â€œfanfic.â€ It wasnâ€™t. The original scene was much shorter: Emma and Olivia two very talented actors who know their characters well expanded it. They werenâ€™t just wasting time or suddenly lacking in talent and insight. They knew what they were doing and it connects all the way back.   So letâ€™s go all the way back! Where do we begin? Episode 1x01 King Viserys wants a son and male heir; he has wanted a son for so long that Rhaenyra his 14-year-old daughter says (ep 1x01) â€œFor as long as I can recall itâ€™s all heâ€™s wanted.â€ What has this done to her? Well for one thing it has made her mother who has difficult pregnancies in ill health for most of her life. This ill health means that Aemma did a lot of lecturing (and trying to keep Rhaenyra from flying and doing other risky things while she was sick) and not a lot of getting to spend quality time with her daughter. A distracted father ruling the realm and a mother sick with trying to give him the male heir he prioritizes above his wife and daughter.  Who has been there for Rhaenyra? Alicent. Alicent was hers. When Rhaenyra flies on her dragon experiencing freedom from all her worries and power and joy she wants ALICENT to be there with her high above the sea looking out over the city:  source: 1x01 script  When Rhaenyra had to have a difficult conversation with her mother it was Alicent she looked to for comfort and emotional support â€“ in an act a cut scene from the script *explicitly calls â€œflirtingâ€*. Rhaenyra relies on and longs for that â€œdisarming kindnessâ€ she says Alicent has.  And it was Alicentâ€™s lap that Rhaenyra flirts about loving to lie upon. Alicent is so much to Rhaenyra that she dreams of running away together just the two of them and Rhaenyraâ€™s bonded dragon Syrax.   Alicent was her cherished girl her comfort and her chief supporter and advisor. She was Rhaenyraâ€™s heartâ€™s rest. And yes - it was a friendship blossoming into flirtation and desire as the two matured. They were on the cusp of something. They were the world to each other.   source  Emma and Olivia get it and have always gotten it. Rhaenyra has this gorgeous yang or solar energy that finds balance with Alicentâ€™s yin or lunar energy. Theyâ€™re a sun and moon couple balancing each otherâ€™s strengths and weaknesses. With Alicent the sword of Rhaenyraâ€™s intense energy has a sheath. A resting place. Her fire has a hearth. And Alicent isnâ€™t drained by people (like Viserys would later doâ€¦) who just take and take and take â€“ hurting her and draining that â€œdisarming kindnessâ€ of hers until sheâ€™s broken and ruined inside. Rhaenyra gives and cherishes in a way that made Alicent feel whole and appreciated.   Rhaenyra goes from being angry (angry the way a jilted lover would be - calling Alicent a â€œwhoreâ€ for what she felt emotionally imo as Alicent cheating on Rhaenyra with her father) to instantly deeply protective and possessive once she learns more. See the cut scene after Viserys reveals his engagement to Alicent:  script pages source photo source  Rhaenyra is ready to take on the whole Seven Kingdoms to protect her girl!  Rhaenyra liked being the focus of Alicent playing the â€œlady belovedâ€ role - reading soothingly to her supporting and encouraging and admiring her teasing her for being naughty advising her about her political situation. She found rest and comfort there - and then Viserys took her mother cutting her open to get his precious son out. And then in his remorse and grief he took comfort in Rhaenyraâ€™s girl (who was forced to give him that precious kindness of hers by her father) and her father *stole her girl too*. Not only did he steal her girl he put her own status as heir into question by having a firstborn son with her - after wounding Rhaenyra deeply by chasing a son as far back as she could remember!  All the â€œshe should be over itâ€ stuff about Alicentâ€¦ if Rhaenyra were a male character people would recognize the wound of having his crush stolen out from under him by his old man at the same time his old man refuses to fully back his status as heir - itâ€™s archetypal! Itâ€™s gd Greek. Your old man trying to keep you from the girl you want from your desires and destiny as an adult.   Rhaenyra makes total sense in the Sept scene - she has the primal wound of a girl who is an HEIR - who wanted to have things and act and possess and stand tall and be the lover to a girlâ€™s beloved in a way only boys are allowed in this societyâ€¦ and whose father took her girl away from her as well as making her feel uncertain of her status in a deeply wounding way. Rhaenyra correctly locates emotionally her rupture from Alicent as where it all went wrong. The Sept scene is about all of that emotionally and it makes total sense. It is also about Rhaenyraâ€™s sheer desperation and comprehension of the horror comingâ€¦ and the most heartbreaking longing to return to a time when Alicentâ€™s heart was her home.   Alicentâ€™s heart was Rhaenyraâ€™s home. And her father stole the girl she loved. He took her and savaged and used and broke her and made her give birth to children she didnâ€™t want (at least not with him) from decades of sex she did. not. want. because even men who think theyâ€™re nice in this society are allowed that - to cut a wife open for a son to use a girl young enough to be his daughter. He vacillated between wounding and affirming Rhaenyra never fully able to honor her as his heir because she was not a boy. And he couldnâ€™t even conceive of her feelings for Alicent because this is a deeply homophobic society - but he was also even seeing it in a platonic light selfish and inconsiderate of her feelings for her best friend.   He kept putting his feelings and needs first over his wife over his daughter over her best friend.   I donâ€™t care if nobody else gets it - the way Emma plays it? They get it. Theyâ€™re an extremely talented actor who wasnâ€™t going â€œoocâ€ in the Sept - they were playing *that*. My father inflicted these primal wounds on me because my coming of age was more like a boyâ€™sâ€“like things that should be allowed girls but are denied themâ€“ and he thwarted me and yet I love him. And I love Alicent and I long for her heart though itâ€™s full of poison and broken things now. Why does it all have to be like this? Why does it have to hurt so much?   The Sept scene is entirely in character for both of them. It is not â€œfanfic.â€ It is not OOC. It is the broken heart of this tragedy bleeding before our eyes.

post_body: I think Iâ€™ve figured out the reasons I find a lot of opinions about â€œbad things the Greens have doneâ€ in House of the Dragon to be a particular flavor of boring: 1) most of the things they do are very much a group effort in fuckups and flattening incidents into one characterâ€™s â€œfaultâ€ to bash them often takes the thematically interesting bits out and 2) Alicent and her kids especially tend to contribute to fuckups in a way where they couldnâ€™t possibly have done anything except fuck up given the people they were shaped into by the adults of their childhoods which is the entire compelling tragedy of them so itâ€™s very meh when they get positioned like well-adjusted adults just choosing to suck

post_body: EWAN MITCHELL INTERVIEWED BY TV GUIDE.   â€œHeâ€™s been watching How to Train Your Dragonâ€ â€” Mitchell told TV Guide. â€œYou get a sense that Aemond is operating on the peripheries.â€ â€œYou donâ€™t know where he is in every scene and you are left wondering what he is up to.â€ â€œAegon and his crew very much violated Aemondâ€™s safe space and they catch him in the most vulnerable state we will probably ever see Aemond: belly up.â€ â€œThey humiliate him.â€ â€œIn a moment his code comes into play and that facade comes up.â€ â€œIt is the image of someone who does not care what you think of him and sees himself as bulletproof.â€ â€œIn the Battle of Rookâ€™s Rest you do have to wonder if Aemond always planned to get back at Aegon or whether or not Aegon was just in the way and he was collateral damage.â€ â€œI think that Aemond views the world through a very black-and-white filter.â€ â€œYou are either with him or against him and if you get in the way thatâ€™s on you.â€ â€œThe first time Aemond uses Vhagar in Episode 10 of Season 1 he lets his emotions get the better of him and it was ultimately an accident when he kills Luke.â€ â€œBut he witnessed firsthand what these dragons are capable of.â€ â€œThat is in contrast to Aegon who in the skies over Rookâ€™s Rest didnâ€™t completely understand what he was getting himself into.â€ â€œBut Aemond does now and it was purely intentional what he did this time.â€ WHAT DOES IT MEAN THAT AEMOND TOOK A SHOT AT KILLING HIS BROTHER WHOSE CHARRED BODY HE CALLOUSLY WALKS AWAY FROM AT THE END OF THE EPISODE?  â€œMaybe there is a more confident stride in his step now and heâ€™s very much convinced himself that he does have a grip on and control over his dragon and he can use her to do what he so pleases.â€ â€œThis idea that these dragons and their riders are extensions of each other I wonder sometimes if Vhagar in the skies above Stormâ€™s End last season tapped into Aemond and Lucerysâ€™ shared history and that resentmentâ€ â€” he said after apologizing for â€œgeeking outâ€ about dragon lore that he clearly loves to talk about. â€œHe did forgive Luke for taking his eye out but he didnâ€™t forgive the fact that he got away with it.â€ â€œMaybe that hatred was embedded deep down and Vhagar tapped into it in some way shape or form.â€ â€œAemond is scarily perceptive.â€ â€œI donâ€™t want to say he is a seer but he has a calculating quality to him.â€ â€œHe has his own agenda and his own ambition that I think is quite scary.â€ â€œHe can almost see where the chips are going to fall before they land or at least he thinks he can.â€ IN THIS EPISODE IT WAS THE DRAGONS THAT FELL. THOUGHT MITCHELL CORRECTED THE RECORD PRETTY QUICKLY ON THAT POINT.  â€œNot Vhagarâ€ he said with a smile. â€œSheâ€™s still up there.â€

post_body: Letâ€™s get this straight in HOTD ship discourse:  Out of all the so-called â€œpervertedâ€ ships in the show we could name quite a few to be honest.. Daemon/Rhaenyraâ€™s age-gap is close to 20 years apart. We had scenes of them with implied sexual tension even when Rhaenyra was only 14 in episode 1 yet no one seemed to have a problem with that.    Viserys/Alicent..we wonâ€™t even talk about the age-gap between these two because itâ€™s just absurd but it is an arranged marriage. Yet again most people donâ€™t seem to have a problem with this.   Aemond/Alys or Daemon/Alys the largest age-gap thus far considering Gayle Rankin claims that Alys is nearly 400 years old beneath her glimmer.   Lastly Aemond/Lucerys these two have the least of the age-gaps as they are only 3 years apart and yet people still call this the most â€œmonstrousâ€ of all the ships in show-verse. I get it Elliot who plays Luke is far younger than Ewan so the age disparity is more obvious than it should be in canon but so was Matt Smith and Milly Alcock when they portrayed Daemon/Rhaenyraâ€¦Letâ€™s be real though the main reason people are offended by this pairing is because itâ€™s a queer ship. Had Lucerys been a girl there wouldnâ€™t be near as much affront. I know a lot of talented amazing individuals who have written for this ship..particularly aged-up Aemond/Lucerys and none of them deserve the hate directed towards them nor their work when there are far more disturbing ships in the show. Not everyone who supports this pairing condone fanart/works portraying the underage actor. So letâ€™s stop acting like everyone who ships Lucerys/Aemond is demon spawn for seven hells sake. ğŸ¤

post_body: I want to rant about those â€˜leaksâ€™ that are on the internet (about seasons to come not season 2) and honestly it would disappoint me entirely if they ruin Cregan Stark. Like I really hope itâ€™s just rumours and nothing elseâ€¦  The Starks are and have always been â€˜the goodiesâ€™ (every single people in Kingslanding knows that Starks never break their oaths - theyâ€™re loyal noble etc. and for some reason they always repeat â€˜winter is comingâ€™ even if weâ€™re in the middle of the summer leaving people like wtf?)   Anyways. The point is that Starks would never break an oath (and as someone else pointed out Jon breaking his own oath was indeed something that impacted through the series and the storyline). So it makes sense that Cregan helps (even if itâ€™s a little) Jace (because he respects the Oath from his father to king Viserys and Queen Rhaenyra)   it just doesnâ€™t make sense the showrunners want to make Cregan a villain that supports Aegon - why would he accept Jaceâ€™s proposal then? Iâ€™m any case he couldâ€™ve killed him by throwing him from the Wall while his dragon wasnâ€™t near and send a raven to Aegon or something. Thatâ€™s why it was so important to show us Jace/Cregan relationship (Cregan saw him as a brother because Jace reminded him his own death brother - they even made a blood pact - something even more solemn than a oath by words)  Iâ€™m any case it makes sense Cregan being in Rhaenyraâ€™s side and still be ruthless in The Hour of the Wolf but naming Aegon king for the history books. Here are my thoughts.   Cregan unlike Ned Stark (RIP) didnâ€™t seem to give second chances in this part of the Dance of the Dragons because he had a different background (letâ€™s remember Nedâ€™s downfall was trusting Littlefinger and warning Cersei). Cregan doesnâ€™t trust anyone because he was betrayed by his own kin (his uncle wanted to stay in the power and he had to take what was rightfully his). He sees this child (the little brother of Jace - who he considered a brother) and I bet he wants to leave him in the best hands. Yes Larys and Corlys killed Aegon but that only showed that they could change their intentions in any given moment - he definitely needed to take that from the root - I think thatâ€™s why he wanted to execute all of those that were involved in the plotting to kill Aegon II. It was the usurper but it was their king (how was Cregan supposed to trust them?)  Now about him naming Aegon II as the official king in the historyâ€¦ i think it was probably to calm those who were still team green and avoid them to continue the war (he even married Aegon with Jaehaera to reinforce this). At the end Aegon Rhaenyraâ€™s son was sitting in the throne and he had to take the most strategic decisions to keep that kid safe in the first moments of his reign. Because he owed it to Jaceâ€¦ because he made an Oath.   Anyways letâ€™s hope HotD doesnâ€™t ruin Cregan and letâ€™s see what happensâ€¦

â€” visits a brothel with his friends. again aegon takes a young lad to this place to â€œhelpâ€ him lose his virginity. again aegon tells the boy itâ€™s â€œtime to get it wetâ€. he doesnâ€™t care that the boy is obviously uncomfortable. he wouldnâ€™t understand.  then he finds aemond who lies with the same brothel worker that aegon introduced to him and paid to take aemondâ€™s virginity. aegon laughs at aemond. partly because aegon was badly hurt by aemondâ€™s reckless actions and wishes to humiliate him. partly because again he feels superior to aemond enjoys the feeling of being more experienced than his younger brother. he asks aemond whether he â€œfucked her like a houndâ€ â€” a comment thatâ€™s way over the top in this situation. nobody joins aegon in his laughter he continues to laugh regardless. he knows heâ€™s the king now nobody would dare oppose him.   aegon doesnâ€™t shy away from nudity. upon witnessing his brother in such an intimate situation creepily similar to the situations alicent has caught aegon in he laughs. when aemond gets up and presents his bare body for all to see aegon looks slightly repulsed yet he stares directly at him yet he keeps on laughing â€” still trying to belittle aemond as if saying â€œyouâ€™re smallâ€.   aegon is an addict. he drinks to fill a void to lessen his boredom to forget to feel something â€” something other than loneliness rejection the weight of failure pressing on his shoulders. besides drowning in alcohol having sex is his way of coping. it makes him feel well educated superior to those with less experience. pleasuring a woman â€” itâ€™s the only thing he feels heâ€™s actually good at. he has no boundaries he has no shame he has no compassion for those he uses for his amusement and pleasure.  itâ€™s toxic and twisted yet insanely intriguing.
